text:
I was in Las Vegas for my high school reunion and was recommended 808 for lunch. I graduated in Hawai'i, and had brought a friend to my reunion. We had lunch at 808 and I was in my happy place. 

You step inside and I instantly felt like I was back in Hawai'i. The food was so good and the staff treated us like old friends. I had the sliced teri burger and washed it down with a lilikoi passion. 

My friend isn't from the islands and her only familiarity with them, is through me. She had the Teri steak lunch and ate every bit! We'll definitely be going back on our next trip to Vegas.
I still dream of their Garlic Chicken...I'm going to sleep right now!

Husband had the garlic chicken.  I tried 808 Special with Kalua Pork & Cabbage and Korean Chicken Wings.  Both orders came with rice and a choice of macaroni or tossed greens.  We got one of each.  The garlic chicken was delicious!  The Korean Chicken Wings were delicious.  The macaroni was ok, nothing fancy.  The tossed greens is a small salad with chopped lettuce, carrots, tomatoes, and cucumbers.  The dressing was oily and barely had a flavor.  The Kalua Pork was very bland.  It didn't have much of a flavor, either.  The lady who served us was very friendly.  I would be willing to go ack and try other dishes.

I gave this place 3 stars not because of the food, but because customer service. The really short girl who works the register and takes orders has been exceptionally rude the past 2 or 3 times that I have visited. A member of our group had a question about a menu item, and she replied "Haven't you ever been here before??". Why yes, we have, quite a bit actually. But I didn't know that meant we couldn't inquire about the menu.

If she straightens out her attitude, I'll give this place 4 stars. The food is good. The portions are a bit small. I personally like the furikake seared ahi. The chicken katsu is better at #1 Hawaiian BBQ on Lossee though.

Favorite Hawaiian grinds in Vegas. Being from Hawaii it's always hard to find yummy places that remind you of home. When we first moved here we found L&L, it was alright but we didn't want to go back. Driving around we found 808, decided to stop and glad we did! The staff are super friendly, the food is amazing!!!! They already know us and know when they see my daughter she likes the spam musubi. My husband always orders the garlic chicken, me, I have to try everything on the menu. Everything I've had is so tasty!! I love walking in and saying 'hey Aunty' like I'm back home. :)
If your in the mood for Hawaiian food and your on the North side of Las Vegas, this is the place! Garlic Chicken and Kalbi ribs are quite tasty!

It's hard to find a decent grilled tuna (ahi) without paying a fortune for a meal. I've been to a few Hawaiian style restaurants, this is my new favorite. I waited for my Garlic Ahi (tuna), they will give you an option if pan fried or grilled. I picked grilled. You also have an option if mini (1 scoop of rice) or regular (2 scoops). I waited for a good 12 minutes for my food. 
I ate my food non-stop and finished it in less than 10 minutes, it was so good. Ahi was seasoned just right, grilled just right, rice was not overbearing with garlic flavor. It was just perfect. I would have paid $26-30 for it in a nice strip restaurant. I paid around $9.50. Although there are other meals between $6.00-9.00, I was so glad I ordered this. This establishment has a bright future. Will definitely come back.

I really went in here looking for some lumpia but they didnt have any :(. Anyway, I got the chicken katsu with rice and macaroni salad. It wasnt disgusting but it wasn't delicious either. The katsu was crsipy but lacked flavor. The macaroni salad could use a bit more seasoning as well. This was my first time eating at this place. Though I've had better, I would still return to try something else.

I got the Kalbi tonight with rice and macaroni salad. The latter two were good. I got a Kalbi medium rare, which is was. The sauce was good, I just didn't expect the meat to be so chewy. I definitely want to go again and try something else when I get the chance.

I've been to this place quite a few times in the past but they must've gone under new management because this had to be the worse experience I've ever had here. First, the cashier (older lady) was flat out rude and made you feel unwanted. Then I ordered a canned juice and asked for a cup and she told me that those cans get the (low budget) kid water cups. Lastly, the food was absolutely terrible, it tasted old and as if it was laying around in the back and microwaved once ordered. Also tasted like it was cooked with old nasty oil. This is the last time I go to this place and I can't believe they're ok with the quality of food they serve and service they provide. 
Thanks for making sure we don't return to your business you did a great job of losing a long time customer.

The food here was delicious.  My wife and I ordered two plates -- the 808 special with katsu and garlic chicken, plus an order of kalbi.  Usually when we go to eat plate lunches we just share a single plate, but we were hungry and somehow we finished both plates.  It was that good.  My only gripe is that the plates were a bit on the expensive side.  I'd say prices are double what we'd pay in Hawaii.  But the quality was top-notch.  Service was also good, and you can tell the people running the place are the real deal, having lived in Hawaii at some point in the past.  I felt like I was eating at my auntie's place.

Definitely worth a visit!

A place that makes you feel like home. Aunty Pili & her son runs the place along with Aunty Norma. The wifey an I are there every Friday's & sometimes Saturday's for lunch & dinner. An you might see somebody you know........

A-M-A-ZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!! LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!!! Everything on the menu looked so good!! Garlic chicken was the BOMB!!!!!! MUST EAT AT THIS PLACE!!! I recommend ordering ahead before you go! Gets very busy!!!
Great food the best Hawaiian food I have been to in las Vegas I have tried the rest now this is the best :)

My boyfriend and I never had Hawaii in food and we want it to try it and so we made a good choice food was excellent. Seen like a family restaurant and felt very warm welcoming there was one lady we think she's the owner she's very friendly she stopped by our table and asked us how was the food and if we need a box we told no because we on vacation ,she was talking to us for a little we told her we came to car show Sema ... The food was great and the service was outstanding!!!!

I visited this place for lunch because I was in North Las Vegas visiting some friends. Let me start by saying that this place doesn't have much of a reputation, but I wasn't put off that my friends live around the corner from 808 and haven't tried the food. 

My first impression upon walking in the door was the decor was definitely dated. It sort of reminded me of L&L. They tend to put all of their focus on the food and neglect certain aspects of the restaurant, but I don't go out to eat for the decor. Everything was clean, but a few of the plants and walls were speckled with a bit of dust. 

After minor observation of the surroundings, I was greeted by a kind lady behind the register waiting patiently for me to order my food. She had a very kind and warm smile. She was also very patient while I was quickly perusing the menu, which was a bit difficult to read. As I was waiting for my food (carryout), I noticed this woman greeting people dining in and picking up plates licked clean by happy customers. 

Now down to the meat of this review. I had the two item combo plate with green salad. It rang up close to $9...A little on the high side, but it was worth every bit of it. I ordered the Kalbi Beef and Garlic Chicken which was served with two pillowy blankets of rice. The Kalbi was second to none in Las Vegas. It was prepped differently than other places like L&L and AK. The ribs were of a thicker cut so you get more meat in each bite. Also, the rib meat is served sliced and presented on top of the cut ribs itself. The Garlic Chicken was nice and crisp. The chicken came drizzled with a garlic sauce and sprinkled with sesame seeds. 

Overall, even though I didn't dine in, the food was the best in its class (in Vegas, of course). I just wish 808 was closer to where I live because I can always appreciate good Hawaiian food. Do your stomach a favor and go to 808 brah!

If you are getting a lil tired of the Teriyaki Madness a couple doors down, then give 808 a shot.  Their Garlic Chicken with Miso Mayo is phenomenal!  The chicken is crispy and moist and that miso mayo is to die for.  The only reason I didn't give them five stars was that their short ribs were a lil pricy and the portion was a lil small.  Other than that, definitely worth a visit.

WOW! The food here is amazing! Decided to try this restaurant based on the high Yelp rating in the area and I'm super happy about that decision! The Kanaka Fries were fantastic and the Garlic Chicken on rice was so tasty!
The ladies taking the food orders are so friendly and helpful and evidently are very proud of the food they serve there. We had no idea what to order when we saw the menu and when we asked for recommendations, they were happy to guide us!
Highly recommend this place!

I ordered the Kalua pork and spicy chicken. My pork & cabbage was extremely salty & puree like, chicken half cold, greasy & over garlicky and not fresh. I couldn't eat the pork. Asked for something else. Was told NO. Lady said she'd replace it she went back and after 5+ min came back to inform me, the whole batch WAS salty and ruined. Replaced w/pork and gravy. It took forever to come out; I just got it to go. I heat it up today for lunch. Alot of fat & salty.. I'll give 2 stars because the staff was very friendly. .  just over all to salty and unsatisfying for me. Mac salad had chunks if potato in it. I usually go to LULU in Centennial,  and that's where I will continue to go...

This place is great. I love coming here. They said they were raising the price so I don't know how much a plate is now. What I usually order is already pricey!!!! But the food is great. I highly recommend the garlic chicken with miso mayo!

Just a gem out in north vegas.  Very family friendly as the staff all seems to be related.  My first time had khalbi ribs (phenomenal) and sesame chicken.  The chef asked if I wanted a sample of korean chicken, I said yes, and was treated to the most succulent zingy delight ever.  I get it every time now.  You can get it as wings or he will do it with thigh meat.

The daily specials are always great, and prices per portion are legit.  I can't recommend it highly enough, especially in an area with very few unique spots like this.  Just go!
Garlic chicken is the best. Great service and great food. They do have military discount. Don't hesitate to try here.
The best Hawaiian food I've had in the states. Family owned and operated, awesome food and chill environment.
Uncle willys chicken is mind blasting!  Just make sure they have it before you go.

I've been eating at competing restaurants here in Vegas for years, but I just spent 2 weeks in Hawaii earlier this year and it changed my perspective. I feel like this place is the most authentic Hawaiian food I've had in Vegas, hands down--especially this close to my house. The reviews back it up! Sometimes you gotta wait a little while, but it's always worth it. Friendly staff compensates for any wait you might have. This is a MUST visit if you're in this part of town. My favorite is the Mahi Mahi.

Service can be kind of slow here, but I'll gladly wait for their deep fried spam musubi.  DANG that stuff is good!  Their other food is pretty yummy, too, as long as you're not trying to be health conscious!
My son and I had dinner here one night, but ended up being so disappointed. The food wasn't great, a bit bland and a bit pricey for what you get. We love plates so we'll continue to go to L&L!

I LOVE Hawaiian mixed plate "BBQ." I was first introduced to this style of cuisine when my Aunt and Uncle decided to retire on Oahu. When I visited them in Oahu I found a "Hawaiian BBQ" joint and ordered the Loco Moco because the name sounded cool. I ended up sleeping away the better half of the afternoon but in all fairness, the Loco Moco was meant to alieve a righteous hangoever, which it accomplished quite nicely.

So I was totally stoked to find 808 which was just as amazing and authentic as the Hawaiian BBQ joints that are in Hawaii. To put them to the test, I ordered the Loco Moco, and true to expectations, it put me to sleep for the better half of a day (your are warned).

I returned on a second occasion and had the glazed, thinly sliced short ribs and they were absolutely amazing. This is definitely a new favorite; the prices are right, the food is great and the staff is friendly. Just go here ALREADY, Especially if you've "over indulged" the previous night!

So I had the spicy Korean wings (very delicious, breaded and seasoned just right)and moko loco (fried egg on top of giant puck sized beef patties covered in gravy and rice on the bottom) with macaroni salad. Very good, can't eat this everyday but it's a great weekend indulgence. Very good to try at least once if you are getting bored with food like I was. Not in a food rut anymore.

I really liked this place the first time I went there, I had the garlic chicken with the miso mayo which was very good! Second time I had the firecracker chicken with the rice and Mac which was even better than the garlic chicken cause it was crispier but the third time it was horrible! The chicken was chewy and it was soggy, theMac was grainy. I will say that the service is always great but the food is a gamble. Do not get the food to go I think they rush cooking it and doesn't come out as good as if you ate it there.

I was craving lau lau and turned to yelp, which lead me to 808. They serve it on Friday's only . I've been here before awhile back so I knew the food would be good .  
     I chose the lau lau plate you have a choice of kalua pig , beef stew or tripe stew . I chose the tripe stew. It also comes with a little container of lomi salmon and rice of course.
     The lau lau had a big piece of pork and fat and a nice piece of butter fish.  Lau lau was avg size , pretty solid as far as lau lau goes.  
    The tripe stew was delicious it had celery , potato , carrots and tripe of course. 
                 The stew was a tad bit thin for me and needed more tripe, but the flavor was spot on , the moment I put the first spoonful in my mouth , my taste buds said WOW!
   Only if my wife ate tripe , I would be making it right now. 
     Oh yeah for an appetizer? I had to get a spam musubi , they were piled right next to the cash register(smart move 808) and I could not resist.
    It was a solid spam musubi with teri sauce and still warm :) 
    When the craving hits me for lau lau, I will make the long drive to 808:)

Very friendly Aloha Spirit. Told her it was our first time here and she offered us a delicious sample without me asking. 

Delicious Garlic chicken - can ask for special mayo on the side. 

Tried fried spam musubi - A-M-A-Z-I-N-G (tip- add sriracha for a kick to mellow out the sweet sauce)

Bowl portion is enough for lunch - it comes with rice only,so no salad or Mac salad)

Da 808 special is a great option - pick two of the meats to try with rice and salad.

This restaurant is one of the best Hawaiian restaurants I've gone to in North Las Vegas. A very welcoming atmosphere with great customer service. The food here is absolutely delicious provided with a great variety on the menu. I will definitely pay more visits.

I ordered the Kalua pork and cabbage with rice and mac salad. The mac salad was average, the pork was bland and the rice was stale. It was like eating 3 day old rice......gross. I was disappointed with the quality of food and will not be returning.
We love this place!! Good food and good service...the wait is a little long but that's because they make it as u order...fresh:) portion size is good..true Hawaii style home cooking.
Norma and her clan of awesome chefs know what's up! Their food is DELICIOUS! Make sure you don't leave without ordering the fried spam masubi!!!!

Kalbi Ribs was good and the Garlic Chicken was ok. They give you two very small scoops of rice so I had to order a extra scoop. The macaroni salad had no taste and would suggest putting a little salt and pepper to make it eatable!
My husband and I tried this place for dinner and loved it! We had the garlic chicken and short rib plate. It was fantastic! We will definetly continue to visit this place for great Hawaiian food.

Although it was far from my place but we tried to manage to drop by yesterday after we went to flea market because my partner thought they have ahi poke just like we were used to get when we were back in Hawaii lol. Anyways, it was my first time trying on their firecracker chicken... it was really delicious and I'm sold to it. 

The place is so small and we were debating if we should try it out or not because they had a long queue already but I guess we should just suck it up a little bit.  I'm glad I had the patience because that chicken was my favorite now.
Really nice place.  The staff was helpful and the garlic chicken and Katsu chicken were outstanding.
I love 808 Hawaii Grill the BBQ chicken and salad with rice is my favorite !!!!

Aloha Friday!!!  Hawaiian plate at 808HMP is the best!! Laulau, Kalua Pig, Chicken Long Rice, Lomi Salmon, Haupia, and of course Rice!!!  I am so glad to have this place near home.  I eat here every week at least 1-2 times.  Which is why I am fluffy!!

So bomb!!! I love this place, compared to the other hawaiian food places in town this one is the best. I really will never get sick of this place, the whole restaurant has good vibes and the people that work there are awesome!

Service was friendly enough and the food was okay. We ordered the barbeque beef and garlic chicken. Garlic chicken was good, but the beef was a little bland and dry. I would return for the garlic chicken only.

The garlic chicken and pork chops are excellent. But they really shined when they did a special happy birthday song and dessert for my friend without being asked just because they knew it was her birthday. Mahalo. My friends and I will be back.

Hands down, my favorite Hawaiian restaurant in Vegas!  I almost always get the kalbi and the garlic chicken.  Wanting to try others but they're too good to pass up!  Service is always fast and friendly.
It's your standard Hawaiian food with the exception of the garlic chicken.  It's the best thing here and the portions are huge. Also the kalbi is decent but just a little too fatty.
My husband's favorite hawaiian food. I was hesitant to try it at first, but the garlic chicken is to die for. This will become a regular for sure.

I eat out a lot and mite be one of the worse Hawaii style place I ever went to in Vegas. Service slow, you don't get a lot for what you pay for, food taste ok. Really disappointed. Actually first Hawaiian place That disappointed me. Doesn't take much to make this local boy happy. =(

Im born and raised in Hawai'i and i was very disappointed with the service and actual food I bought from here. Food was bland and you could tell the food wasn't made with Aloha or even any effort. Tastes like its made for quantity and quality. I tried to order the Kalbi but they said they were out. Us Hawaiians love our Kalbi short ribs. You should never be out haha. But all in all this place reminds me of any other Hawaiian food place like Aloha kitchen. If I want Good Hawaiian food I'll go to Island Flavor from now on. Now that's good Hawaiian grindz.
Great food. But the lady on the cashier is very very cranky! Food reminds me of hawaii. Lady reminds me of grumpy from snow white! Three stars for you grumpy!!!!
First time there I was recommended the garlic chicken and it was delicious. Very happy with the service and I would definitely recommend this place!

Traveling from the South side to the North side to check this place out for the first time. Heard that the Garlic Chicken is a hot item! The restaurant is decent size with table seating. The menu had really good items. Bonus on the Mix plate option - you can select two different items on a plate and choice of macaroni salad or mixed green salad. 
They were out of Garlic Chicken! Sad! Staff said they were busy today & ran out. Items ordered: Deep Fried Spam Musubi, Fried Noodles & 2 Mixed plates - Kalbi & Hamburger Steak with grilled onions and mushrooms, & the second Mix Plate - Kalbi & Korean Chicken wings (mild). Side note when ordering the Kalbi on the mix plate there's an extra charge of $4.00. Didn't mind paying. Food served hot and fresh! Portions good size. The Kalbi was cooked good & portioned well. The food was very good! Will have return to try the Garlic Chicken!

GOOD FOOD.
I think 4 people work there including the owners. All of them are very nice and friendly. They remember your name and what you eat. The chef even pokes his head out of the kitchen-to-dining room window to say hi.
These are a few of my favorite things: Garlic shrimp, garlic chicken, bbq chicken, salmon, daily and weekly specials.
They give military discounts. A plus.
The only other Hawaiian restaurants I've been to in LV are L&L and Aloha Kitchen and let me tell you that 808 destroys those two. In fact, I never plan on going back to those other two places again because if I did, I'd be too busy wishing I was at 808 that I wouldn't be able to enjoy their sub-par food.
This is the ONLY place to visit for Kalbi ribs.  The food is amazing and the family atmosphere makes this a beautiful dining experience.

The best local food in Vegas! HANDS DOWN. The garlic chicken with miso mayo the chicken katsu curry the ribs YUM, & my FAVORITE the hamburger steak MY OH MY!! Everything is Suuuper ONO. Not to mention the staff, many servings of Aloha here!!! The only thing I'd change is to live closer than I already do :0) on a scale from 1 to 5 stars I'd give them 10!

Service was as excellent as it could get. Ahi Katsu special was as good as it sounds. My daughter had the kalbi ribs that they cooked to her preference and even cut into little pieces which saved me about 20 mins. The  Mac salad has potatoes in it, nice touch. The fries were salty but delicious. Definitely headed back to try the garlic shrimp.

This place is alway good for take out. I always get the oriental salad with garlic chicken.  My husband keeps making me try new things and they are always good, but I LOVE this salad. We  sat inside today and the presentation of the salad is amazing.  I had no idea how beautiful they plate their food cause it's always in Togo containers. Come in sit down and enjoy great food that looks pretty too.
LOVE THEIR FIRECRACKER CHICKEN! Food is Ono, worked get plenty aloha...how much better can it get. I was missing Maui till I came and ate here. :)

I had the garlic chicken with garlic ahi tuna plate... Garlic chicken was pure heaven ... Ahi was good but I forgot to order it seared instead of grilled.. So it was a bit over cooked because of my error in ordering... But overall very good!

I live in Henderson and it's totally worth the drive to come out here for some good Hawaiian food.  It's in the middle of a plaza where there's a poke place a few restaurants down, but they serve poke here too. I come here for the chicken though. It's the juiciest and tastiest Hawaiian style chicken I've had since living in Vegas.

I've made the drive out here several times, and I've gotten the Furikake chicken, grilled chicken, and garlic chicken. Each visit has yet to disappoint me. They get the chicken right every time and it was so good, I picked it up one last time before I moved out of Vegas. No matter where you live, it's definitely worth the trip to come out here for some fantastic Hawaiian food.
this place is solid.   the kalbi is winnas.  many places the kalbi is not as good, the fried noodles is great, hard to go wrong with very many things here.

We chose 808 HMP for our son's graduation party..on graduation day. From planning to delivery everything went smoothly. With Brenton's catering expertise, his recommendations on how many pans of food to order for the amount of people invited saved us a lot of money.  We over estimated and HE made the right adjustments.  We had great comments about how incredible the food was.  I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND 808 MHP for all of your catering needs.  They go above and beyond.

First time coming here. I ordered the Teri Beef Bowl. The meat wasn't warm as I'd expect. I'm not sure if it has been sitting out for awhile before it was served to me, but the flavor of the meat was really good.
I ordered the garlic chicken and beef. Good flavor but the meat was too fatty for my taste. I've also never had Hawaiian food so my review is basted soley on my personal taste.
Big Fan of Hawaiin Food in general, but this place blows L&L out the water!!!! Must try!!!!

My experience recently pushed me to write this review. A friend and I came to visit Las Vegas for a weekend and had a rough first day. After experiencing some disappointments, we decided the next day, to eat here. IT's not our first time, but it reassured that it definitely wouldn't be our last. All I remember is instantly being overwhelmed with comfort as I got my order and took my first bite. My friend even looked over and we both just read that we both were surprised at the taste of the food.  I can't say nothing but good things about this place! Honestly, this food is the closest thing I've gotten to Hawaiian food since I got back from Oahu. Seriously, I think this restaurant is one of the top 10 restaurants I visit when I go to Las Vegas and it always hits the spot. If you want to transform your day instantly, this is the ticket. 

Their food is great. It's sweet, savory, crunchy, unctuous, and hearty all at once. It defines what Hawaiian food is and is very accurate to the true thing. I personally think that everything on the menu is delicious, so you can't go wrong when you go here. That's just one of those things that make this restaurant such a great place for me, because it is not only delicious, but deliver greatness in each of their items they offer. I love their kalbi ribs, moco loco, and chicken variations. These are the best! Even the salad is amazing because of their dressing. The portions are huge, and always come out more than satisfied. And that's saying a lot because my appetite is black hole level. 

Aside from their food, the service is great too. They are always kind, and deliver your food to you when you're eating in. I believe that's where the heart of this place lies really. So let's look at this: Food quality: CHECK! Food quantity: CHECK! Authenticity: CHECK! Food Variety and Appeal: CHECK and CHECK! Service: CHECK! You can't go wrong here folks. I highly recommend this place especially if you're an out-of-towner, because I guarantee it will hype up your experience

Thee ABSOLUTE BEST HAWAIIAN FOOD IVE EVER TASTED!!! I always get the 808 mixed plate with Garlic chicken and Kalbi short ribs and green salad. It never lets me down!!! I get extra miso mayo on the side for some extra dipping. I LOVE 808 HAWAIIAN Food!!! If you are in the Vegas area it is a MUST TRY!!! So excited about it after writing  this review that in about to go and get some!!!!

The garlic chicken is amazing. The miso mayo made the meal. I am still unsure what is in a lot of what they sell but everything I have tried has been great.  Last time we were there they had a slice of pumpkin desert that we took home to eat. Omg it was amazing.  Like pumpkin pie with a nut crust and whip topping on top. Now I want one just tiping this. I'm not sure if this is a regular item but it should be. The only thing I would change about the place is the decor.

So the first time we went there a couple weeks ago was very good. Everyone was so nice and friendly and I was raving the next day to my friends. Then we went last nite and ordered 39 $ worth of food. Tipped 5$ cash. Food order on the card. Asked for it to eat there and they packed it to go. I know they close at 9 and I know they want to go home at the end of the day. We all do. But if ur restaurant close at 9 and we come at 820 u pack out stuff to go? That was kinda rude. But I think it was cuz the owners were there the first time and this time they weren't there or we d idnt see them. And we ordered saimin. It's soup. The components of the soup are packed separate and we share so we just said oh well let's go home then since they obviously want us to go. It's 25 minute drive for us from home. Maybe we no go no more
I'd fly back to Vegas just to eat here. The short ribs were worth every buck! A must try.

This is a great find in Las Vegas.  It's a bit of a drive for those of us that live in Summerlin but it's worth it!  

We drove out there for lunch on a Tuesday afternoon.  Three of us ordered the garlic chicken with miso mayo and I ordered the won ton min.  The chicken blew my family members away.  Wonderful flavor and great mac salad to boot.  I really enjoyed the won ton and the saimin noodles in my soup.  The rest was a little too salty for me, but good noodles alone are worth it for me and besides, others might not think too much of the sodium.  The broth flavor is very traditional Hawaiian flavor and even has seaweed in it, kamaboko, sweet egg, green onion and ham plus char shiu.  Sadly, they were out of the Hawaii-imported fried saimin.  The friendly lady there said they get shipped in every Thursday and the person who took the order had been out the previous week.  Next time fo sure!  

It took an unusually long time for my family to get their chicken.  The same lady above kept saying sorry and even offered to heat up my soup for me and gave us a free piece of pumpkin cake!  I was blown away.  Over the top customer service.  She even chatted us up about the part of the Islands she's from.  (We are from the middle of Oahu.)  All in all, a great experience!  I even bought a t-shirt!
Great food and service the garlic chicken is the best this is a must try if you are in the area
This place is amazing! The 808 mixed plate with Garlic Chicken, Kalbi Ribs & Green Salad is what I get every time.
I had the garlic chicken (DELICIOUS) and the portions are huge.  All the food was amazing, the staff was super nice and friendly...definitely willing to try again.... And again.... And again!!!

So happy this establishment is so close to our home. The food is great from the garlic chicken to the spam musubi. You cant go wrong ordering anything from their menu! I had the BBQ beef with the macaroni salad and I couldn't get enough of it. Will definitely be going back when ever I'm in the mood for good Hawaiian food!
So good. Enjoyed the authentic feel of the place. Love me some poke and furikake ahi/mahi mahi! Every plate was awesome. Definitely satisfies your island cravings.

One of my new favorite places to visit when I visit Vegas and want to get some local Hawaiian food. The service here is friendly. I ordered the mixed sesame chicken and shrimp mixed plate. Their servings are generous! I recommend asking for the chicken katsu sauce for their sesame chicken to dip in, tastes great. I plan to visit again on my next trip to Vegas.

I've been coming here twice a week for lunch the past few weeks. The food is awesome and affordable. It's way better than going to a fast food chain. 

I rotate between these:

Loco Moco mini $5.50
Hula Pack w/BBQ chicken $4.50
Shoyu Chicken mini $4.95

All the employees are nice. I call in my order so I don't have to wait. I don't even need to tell them my name anymore!

What is not to love at this place. There's a lot of Hawaiian BBQ in this town but this one is by far the best one that I have a pleasure of eating at. Everything's fresh, great poke. Everything you order is good, great taste, and reasonably priced.

Was in the area for work again. XD 

Came here later in the day this time. around 2ish on a tuesday afternoon. had a few people dining in but they mostly left by the time i got my food. 

Ordered a furikake chicken and the garlic chicken again (double check xD) 

Order came out fairly quick today. 2 scoops of rice, 1 scoop of mac salad, and the two meats. 

Mac salad has cubed of potato in it. interesting XD adds a nice texture to it. 

Garlic chicken. yeah not enough garlic taste :( i almost feel like im eating a chicken katsu with some aioli sauce (mayo based) 

Furikake chicken. same type of fried chicken i believe, but topped with furikake. intesting but not as amazing as some people make it out to be.

If i come to this place again, imma try the loco moco next time ! heh !

Gave them another chance... This time the food was better, the portions were better, and their attitudes were much better. I am hoping my past experiences were exceptions, as I did enjoy the food and my overall dinig experience this time. I will return again soon and hope for a similar experience.

A little piece of Hawaii in Vegas!! I love this place, the employees are great,  they treat you like you're in their house. You need to try the garlic chicken, it's lightly breaded and fried to crispy perfection, a thin glaze of sauce is drizzled with the exact right amount of flavors, enjoy it, I get it every time I visit!!
This is definitely my go-to spot for Hawaiian food.  Their Kalbi Ribs have to be the best in town; and their Garlic Chicken, don't even get me started.  Do yourself a favor and check this spot out!

If your from the islands and have been in Vegas for a while or just wanting some food from back home. This is the place to come to. Everythin is ono. I wish they would open one up on the southwest side of town
great hawaiian spot in north las vegas. Had the hi-style beef and garlic chicken. Food came out within 10 minutes. Great service. Garlic Chicken was the highlight of my meal. It hit the spot.
A little pricey, but I'll pay it everytime to get a taste of home. Very few 808 restaurants are run by actual 808 staff... and these guys take care you!! ALOHA!!

First time at any Hawaiian place--wow so good! They give you a sample if you've never been. Had the short ribs & pork/cabbage & sampled some garlic chicken which was amazing. You can replace the rice with extra salad which was a bonus. I will be back.

We read the review and it lives up to them. The tank full of fish was great. We got to sit right next to it. Service was great. The servings were large but very good. It was a very good value! I would come back here again.

The BEST Hawaiian food in Vegas period end of story. You disagree = you don't know what you are talking about. Fish = awesome quality. Garlic chicken = unbelievable. Fried spam masubi = perfection. This is the best of all by a long long long way.
Best Hawaiian food I've  ever had. I travel 30 miles to come here no where else compares.

Had to get my rice fix, after buying Poke from Poke Express a few doors down.  I ordered the Garlic Chicken after talking to the hostess for a recommendation and boy was she right.  The Garlic Chicken was absolutely delicious.  It was cooked perfectly and was drizzled with an onolicious sauce.  

Located in a small strip mall a bit north of The Strip.  Definitely worth your time to check this place out.  Staff were friendly and I know you won't leave disappointed.

I ordered the BBQ Beef and to be quite honest, it was okay. Once I added hot sauce and soy sauce to the rice everything came together nicely. The side of Mac was really good. Yes, I would come here again. 

Today was the warmest Spring day of the season and it truly was a gorgeous day. Most places were packed due to being Saturday. 808 was no exception and that's why I would gladly return. It a nice restaurant in a busy shopping center.

I was pleasantly surprised at how great the food is here and the funny thing is we have been to other restaurants in the area and kept putting this one on hold. They are also so helpful and nice.  I tried their fried noodles with garlic chicken and was so good, also we tried their BBQ fries which comes as a dipping sauce and is SO YUMMY. We will definitely be back to try other items. What a great find!

there's little places in las vegas that have such great local hawaiian food and this is one of them. by far one of a handful of local places to go and get some real ono food. from da loco moco to the garlic chicken, there's nothing you can go wrong with on the menu. if you're lucky you can catch one of their specials and have a dinner that would make gordan ramsey customers jealous. top notch stuff, def a place I recommend!
Yummy!  My new favorite place to eat... Loving there Spam Masubi though.... I highly recommend coming to eat here if you love Hawaiian food...
In a nice shopping center we have a salmon special in the garlic ahi tuna.  They were both great!  About 25 dollars with a couple of sodas.

This is definitely my favorite Hawaiian restaurant in the whole valley.. (believe me we've tried them all..lol). The fried musubi is awesome and they have the best teri beef!! It's always tender! The staff is great! I've never had a bad experience here!
When we are feeling home sick we head to 808. The food is delicious!! Very homemade and the portions are large. The Aloha spirit comes thru the service and each dish is made with love.

Wow!  It's been a while since we've been back!  Sorry 808!  Brenton the Chef always has some awesome daily specials going on and their usual daily specials always hit the spot.

Today happened to be the daily special for ahi tofu patties.  It came highly recommended by all of the staff and they were not kidding!  The mixture of ahi tuna and tofu was the perfect ratio.  The breading was perfectly crispy on the outside and the mayo dressing drizzled on top was a fantastic compliment.  Both me and my man wolfed it down like there was no tomorrow!

Other good ol' standby's:
1.  Loco Moco - for gravy and ooey gooey egg lovers
2.  Hamburger Steak - for the savory gravy lover
3.  Beef Stew - for those cold winter days
4.  Saimin Salad 

Tip:  Looks like the word is spreading that they are tasty, so beware of long lines.  Plan accordingly and like other yelpers mentioned, it might not be so bad to call in and order ahead.

Conclusion:  It's a family run restaurant where they treat you like family and they feed you with comforting Hawaiian favorites.

I love the fried spam musubi*licking fingers*
Love! Love! this place! I forgot what else I ordered...but it was oh so Ono!!!!

The ribs is amazing ! And the garlic chicken is a must try. But I can't explain in words how horrible the service is. The lady is so rude and doesn't care what so ever about you. You have to be really really nice to her just so she doesn't give you a hard time. I often carve the food here but I hesitate due to how awful the service is. It's like you have to please her. If you asked for miso mayo she will charge you and depending on her mood she might give it to you in a bigger or smaller container base on how nice you are to her. I'm sorry but the restaurant business is so competitive you shouldn't treat customers like they are a bother to you.
The food tastes just as good as it does back home!!! The portions are big and the prices aren't too bad either.

This has to be my favorite Hawaiian spot around town. Everything I've tried was very tasty, cooked to perfection. I'm actually quite impressed with their food. Good portion size (enough to share with someone else) but you'll pay about $10 for pretty much any combo you order. Try the Kalbi Ribs & Garlic Chicken combo!! You won't regret it. :)

I really wanted to like this place but $17.95 for two pieces of cut up short ribs is really expensive as far as plate lunches goes.  The beef stew was good. Nothing special for $11.95 and a side of garlic chicken was $6.95 for a small plate. They were all out of wonton min which is what I really wanted. If this place existed in Hawaii they would fail as no one on the island would pay almost 18 bucks for a short rib plate. They did however have chili pepper water for the beef stew. I dunno I wanted to try something else than my regular go to spot Island Flavor and maybe I'm just spoiled by them cause their kalbi plate is massive you get four thick slices. I would come back here but would try the other dishes and stay away from the over priced short ribs.

808 is great! While their macaroni salad may not be my thing, their garlic chicken has to be on of the best quick dishes in North Las Vegas. Their Kalua pork and Korean wings are also excellent. I can't wait to try even more of their menu! Awesome place.

I am giving this place a 4 star review for now. We've tried only 3 different plates, but so far they were good. 

We ordered the 808 special with the garlic chicken and kalbi ribs and right away it reminded my husband of this restaurant he used to go to back in the day in Maui. The garlic chicken was so crispy with the tempura batter they use. Creamy miso sauce on top of the kalbi ribs is yummy. 

Unfortunately,I was greatly disappointed when I went in and got their Friday special of the Pork Lau Lau that comes with chicken long rice and supposed to have lomi-lomi salmon and haupia. Well the lau lau wasn't all what I expected, like the ones in Hawaii which are big, full of butterfish and fatty pork. My lau lau was small, dry and not tasty. Plus, my plate didn't come with the salmon nor the haupia, which was a bummer. However, what saved the plate for me was the chicken long rice which was really flavorful. 

Maybe, one day I will find a Hawaiian restaurant out here in Vegas that can serve up a bombass pork lau lau like in Hawaii.
Good, casual restaurant serving Hawaiian comfort food. Friendly service. Generous portions. Brisk takeout business. Daily specials and food overall is tasty. Will go again when we are in town.
Brah if you'd looking for the real Hi kind grinds this the spot boo. Hands down the best loco moco in Vegas. And there garlic chicken is to kill for. Definitely come and check it out.

I love this place. Food is delicious! Especially their garlic chicken, kalbi and fried saimin. I just took my boyfriend here for the first time and now he's hooked. Great place to go if you want local Hawaiian food.

Just ok. Stopped here because of all the great reviews. They were all out of kalbi even though they'd only been open an hour. Maybe that was our problem. We both had garlic chicken. Not garlicky at all, and deep fried. Kalua pork was mushy and reminiscent of canned tuna. Wouldn't go again.

Let's start with walking in, how awkward. 

No one greets you, an older woman sits in what looks like pajamas with a pen in her ear and carries around the portable phone. Even worst is the punk rock cashier who doesn't smile and has her arms crossed the whole time as if you're inconveniencing her this fine afternoon. God forbid we took too long as it was my first time and wasn't sure what to get, and every time I asked a question my boyfriend answered as she gave me blank stares like I'm a retard.

Oh, and I take it back the kitchen was the only thing exciting as they did greet me while I was attempting to order, probably the only time I felt welcome. 

Boyfriend got Kahlua pig.. I almost thought it was carnitas since it was on the salty side. I ended up with garlic chicken which was actually delicious but it was drowned in so much mayo I thought I was gonna turn into Agustus Glut (Willy Wonka). 

THE WORST PART.. How on earth do you have overcooked rice?! Oh man, it was so unpleasant, I was convinced it was mashed potatoes! 

We decided to take the rest to-go and asked for a box.... yeah it had dirt in it as said punk rock girl stares inside as she handed it to us. So I got up and got another one. 

Pretty lame adventure.

We really hope that they open up somewhere else in North Las Vegas.  They are such a great family and they actually care about their customers.  We really miss them and the amazing food they provided for us!!! Now we have no where to get our cone sushi :(
Most of their chicken plates are worth trying. Garlic chicken is my favorite.  Decent prices. Friendly staff. Must try in north Vegas.

This is by far the best Hawaiian Food I have had in Vegas. If you are craving Hawaiian Food make the trip to this place. It has all everything you would want to eat and more. My wife had one of their daily specials which was a 3 course meal that included a small appetizer ,Miso Pork w/ garlic Mash, and a dessert. I got a mix plate with firecracker chicken and short ribs and an order of fried musubi. It was all super freaking awesome.

Best hawaiian food in town!!! Closest thing to home, I love this place!!! Everything is Da Kine!!! You will love this place, Pure Hawaiian Style!!! If you love Island food this is the best place to go to. Just check out the other reviews. Yummy, Yummy, and Yummy!!!! :) :)

I never thought Hawaiian food could be this gourmet! If you've ever been to L&L, forget that experience, be it good or bad. 808's garlic chicken and ono chicken will blow your mind. And they take their fried musubi to a whole new level, you can't even tell it's spam. This endorsement comes with a 100% guarantee you will not leave this place disappointed. It will literally be your new favorite place.

DON'T order online if you're in a hurry. Lol. They started making my food as I got there, a half hour after I placed the order. But... they got it out pretty quick, and the food is quite tasty. I'm loving the garlic chicken, and the bbq beef has great flavor. I'll most likely be back lol n

Yet another great Hawaiian style plate lunch place that reminds me of home! Awesome food and great portions and prices as well. Phone orders available and choke parking as well. Wish it were a little closer to me but i cant be to picky haha. Places like this make me less homesick when in search of good comfort food from back home. The last time i went i ordered the Loco Moco, and wow the burgers were so thick and tender with the mac salad too! Definitely a winner!

I give it 4 stars only because of the service and wait time. I ordered my food, then a group of 4 guys behind me ordered, then as I'm waiting they received two of their plates first, the two girls behind the counter took their breaks at the same time, received their food from the lady covering the counter as they were on break, then after almost half an hour, I received my two plates and poke. Other than the service which is extremely slow, I will say their food is amazing!

A Hawaiian patient recommended this place to my boyfriend, so I came in when work brought me on a rare trip to this side of town. Posted menu is a bit difficult to read and understand, and the cashier asked if it was my first time- I said yes, and was handed a paper copy but not given any recommendations or info, which I found odd.

Prices seemed a bit higher than other Hawaiian spots in Vegas and  several dishes were listed as "market price" which was a turn off in a fast-casual spot with counter service.  Ordered the 808 combo with teriyaki beef, garlic chicken, spam, rice, and saimin, and added on a spam musubi. The garlic chicken was great, and the musubi was decent, but I wasn't thrilled with anything else- the teri beef in particular was small, thin, and tough to eat. 

Order came out fairly fast, and while I waited I noticed a posted special for poke bowls, which probably would have been a better pick for me. Might give this spot another try if I'm in the area again but this place was lacking the aloha spirit and flavors.

I have been looking for a great Hawaiian food place & this is it. I love the lunch special, especially the garlic chicken & macaroni salad...they are DELICIOUS!  I have tried other menu items but the garlic chicken is #1. I also appreciate the military discount & the friendly staff...keep doing an outstanding job!

My family and I were visiting Las Vegas because my daughter and her volleyball were competing in the SCVA 31st Annual Las Vegas Classic.  Prior to arriving to Las Vegas, 808 Hawaiian Mixed Plate was one of several restaurants I had book marked and planned to visit.  After my daughter's tournament ended on Monday, I brought the entire family to get our Hawaiian food grinds on.  After our visit, anyone visiting Las Vegas and is a fan of Hawaiian food, then 808 Hawaiian Mixed Plate should not be missed.

808 Hawaiian is a pleasant restaurant.  It's not a big restaurant, but it can accommodate a good amount of people.  There are booths along both sides of the restaurant's walls and there are table and chairs lining the middle.  I thought the booths with the wicker basket backings was a nice touch.  The decor is minimal with Hawaiian still pictures hanging on the walls.  There are two televisions mounted high for your viewing pleasure.  808 Hawaiian's menu is not complicated and has a good selection of food.  The ladies behind the counter who take your order were very friendly.  808 Hawaiian is an order first, take your seat, and the food is brought out to you type restaurant.

The reason I took one star away from 808 Hawaiian was because they ran out of poke when we tried to order around 1:30pm.  Also, my kids ordered the Teri Beef bowls, which although they were tasty, the amount of food served was small for the $8 price.  My kids like what they ordered, but it wasn't value for the money.  The main reason why I gave 808 Hawaiian Mixed Plate a strong 4 star rating was solely for the Loco Moco plate I ordered.  808 Hawaiian's Loco Moco was the best Loco Moco I've eaten EVER.  I really loved the white sticky that comes with this plate.  The consistency of the rice was perfect.  This Loco Moco had two large sized hamburger patties cooked just right and seasoned where the meat was really tasty.  The gravy that covered the patties and the rice was slurp worthy and is making me salivate just thinking about it.  The two sunny side eggs on top of everything was cooked just right and yolk flowed perfectly as I broke it.  Not only was this Loco Moco delicious, it was very satisfying.  Must.  Order.  Plate.

I'm glad both my kids play volleyball because there will more future Las Vegas volleyball tournaments.  Just on 808 Hawaiian's Loco Moco plate alone, I will make it a point to visit this restaurant when we visit Las Vegas again.

Oh my God. This food was so good, I cried over it. I have only ever had L&L, etc. I have been so, so ignorant. I didn't know Hawaiian food could been even more delicious. I'm gonna marry the ribs here. So thick! And so tasty. 6 large pieces came in my 1/2 and 1/2 lunch plate and a huge heap of delicious BBQ beef! The hurricane fries need a description on the GrubHub site. I was expecting something a little different. But, it doesn't matter. Everything else was f_@#ing amazing!!!!
Beautiful people, tasty food. You can't usually find quality Hawaiian food on the mainland. Real kalua pork, nice n smoky n not greasy! Now I know why they call LV the 9th island! Go!
Good Hawaiian food but prices keep going up. My kids love the garlic chicken.

My son's favorite place! He loves his hamburger steak! Everything on their menu is delicious! Food is always fresh and the taste and quality are consistent! Friendly staff with lots of Aloha especially Aunty! If you haven't been here yet you should definitely give it a try! Best Hawaiian Food on the North side of town!

Living in Phoenix whenever I visit family in Vegas this is the first place I stop on my way to my families house, every single time. I usually call in my order when I'm on the freeway so I know it'll be ready when I pick it up. This has to be one of the best Hawaiian spots in Vegas, hands down. A small, family owned joint that serves a variety of island specialties that everyone will enjoy. My wife and I usually always get the mixed plate with garlic chicken and ono chicken. We talk about trying something else, but always come back to our original order because the food is just that good. The restaurant itself is in a small strip mall in North Las Vegas and there really isn't much to be expected from it, but the food speaks for itself. If you're from the islands or just love Hawaiian food, trust me and go in and order.

Had the 808 mixed plate with the garlic chicken and BBQ chicken....outstanding!!!!! Had the mac and cheese Hawaiian style its a cold macaroni salad Very good. Not a fan of rice so i could have used more sauce to mix rice with.

Always good service and ono food, my favorite is the mix plate ( you can choose your own) my personal favorite is the garlic chicken and roast pork mix plate with grilled mushrooms and onions. Sooo good!!
Tried this place today and was not disappointed but amazed how good the Korean chicken wings with garlic chicken combo. They have just earned my business.

Love this place! Fried saimin is awesome! Garlic chicken is bomb and Kalbi is on point! 
Service is great as well!

By far, the garlic chicken with miso mayo is one of the most delicious things I have tasted in Vegas. It is basically chicken katsu fried to perfection and topped with some teriyaki/soy sauce (unsure of what exactly) and a miso mayo blend. The result is a complex, flavorful masterpiece. All I can say is: Wow, gotta try this.

The entrees come with a salad (I'd go with the green salad since it is a fresh alternative to the mac salad, which might make the meal too rich overall) and rice. There are also refills on drinks and great service. 

My friend and I brought in some poke from poke express next door and they didn't mind that we ate the poke with our meal (or they didn't know).

P.S. There is a military discount: 10%!

The food is Great! 

First time here the woman at the counter saw that I had no idea and gave me a free sample of their garlic chicken.... YUM! It was so good! Best Hawaiian spot I've had since arriving in Vegas over a year ago. Highly Recommend because of the quality of service and great food.

We started using 808 Hawaii Mixed Plate in Uber Eats in Las Vegas and found this to be a very great service especially if you couldn't leave the house or office.
808 HI Mixed Plate is a touch of Home food when you're here in Vegas, all the food is great and very tasty like home 
I would recommend to try it, you'll love it!!
The people there are so nice and friendly too

Everyone knows Vegas is the 9th island and with that, comes the island style grub cravings to be satisfied. I used to frequent 808 about 2-3 years ago. Unfortunately I never got a chance to leave any reviews. Most recently though, my family and I came in for lunch on Friday and the food just wasn't the same. I raved to the hubby about how delicious the garlic chicken was. But it was soggy when I finally had my first bite. Total disappointment. I got a bento (totally forgot the catchy name of it) that included garlic chicken, fried saimin, a scoop of white rice, 1 slice of fried spam and beef teriyaki pieces. My sis and I shared that bento and some ahi poke from next door (review to follow). My hubby got a plate of kalua pig and cabbage that included 2 schools of white rice and a scoop of mac salad. He totally devoured as much as he could with a third of kalua and a scoop of rice to spare. We washed everything down with some Hawaiian Sun. They had quite a selection to choose from. Going back to my bento, everything else was alright, not good, not bad. Hubby said if he weren't so hungry, he probably wouldn't have eaten as much. He thought it was more on the dry side, but had good salty and smoke flavor. I totally agreed with his comment. The women working the counters and bringing food out are absolute sweethearts and explained all my millions of questions regarding what was included in the bentos, packs and plates. The menu has also changed quite significantly since I was here a couple years ago.

Great local food. Authentic Hawaiian choices. Local aunties running the place. Exactly as expected. 
We had Teriyaki chicken Musubi, Katsu Musubi, saimin & loco moco (hamburger patties, gravy, rice and sunny side up eggs on top). Mac salad was delish, on point! 
Tastes just like home with the island style flavors and many choices to choose from. 
I wish we had eateries like this in Cali.
First timer. Staff extremely friendly showing that aloha spirit. Lunch special garlic chicken was delicious and I could not finish it all. Definitely will be back.

Ever just crave for a good Hawaiian food place that's not L&L or Aloha kitchen??? Not that there's really anything wrong with those two places, but sometimes you want the REAL AUTHENTIC Hawaiian food. Well, this is just the place.

We came in about 30 minutes before they closed, and usually places will give you attitude or try and rush you...this place is nowhere to that. My friend and I are really indecisive and considering the fact that it was my first time, I wanted to look through the menu. I finally made up my mind and the lady in the cashier was so patient with me. I asked if I can order a 2 meat of my choice entree,  because that's what I was in the mood for and she said yes they do that. Although it's an extra $5, I told her I didn't mind. Ordered the Kalbi and Katsu plate and as soon as we got it...i couldn't help but dig in. The sauce they have with the chicken Katsu was also very different compared to the one they usually have at L&L or aloha kitchen.

Overall, I give this place huge 5 stars. They were very welcoming when we walked in, and even brought our food to our table. Soon as it hit 8:30, they didn't rush us at all, but of course we were considerate enough to hurry and leave. Definitely have to try this spot if you haven't!

Heard about this place from fellow Yelpers and finally made it out to give it a try! Took me a while to decide on what to get, but eventually decided on garlic chicken. There were a few people in line ahead of me since it was lunch hour, however, it was kind of odd that my food came out before theirs and about 5 min after I ordered...

The garlic chicken was good and had a perfect amount of garlic flavor. It came with 2 scoops of rice and 1 small scoop of mac salad...just wish they gave more because it was so tasty! It was also nice to get a real plate vs a Styrofoam box! 

808 is fairly reasonable for the amount of food you get, but definitely not as low priced or generous as other Hawaiian places I've been to around town. Garlic chicken and a soda was about 11 bucks. They seem to be very popular as well since people were coming in non-stop during the lunch hour, so come early or be prepared to wait in line! I would come back here again in the future since it's not too far from work.

First time here and I'm in love. The kalbi ribs are meaty and tender. Garlic chicken was flavorful and juicy. I got the 808 mix plate and it was enough for 2 people but I was greedy and devoured most of my plate. I'm so full and happy, we will come again. Customer service was excellent too !!

WOW!  After reading all the reviews there are some real idiots out there when it comes to rating a food establishment.  this place sucks to high heaven.  Food is like crap and the portions are really small, I'm Hawaiian and like to eat like back home where home grown food is served-huge portions.  Yeah the pygmy behind the counter needs to go, she is the biggest little downfall for this place and gives the 808 a really bad tase and name.  I personally will never go back.  Hamburger steak taste like rubber meat, chicken taste like three day ole dead bird, and more.  Service really stinks - service without a smile - attitude.
Customer services is pure hawaiian style! Great services as always.  Food is UNO!

I've been here a few times and it is definitely one of the best Hawaiian BBQ restaurants in the area. The staff is friendly and always makes a fuss over how cute my toddler is. Can't say I blame them! I usually just get the regular BBQ chicken.

Tucked in between a soul food restaurant on the left and building protruding farther on the right, this place was not what I expected. The restaurant was small and felt very fast-casual. Between all the tables maybe forty people could fit? Luckily I went on a Monday night and it wasn't busy at all. It almost reminded me of an old Robertos. A

While ambiance is not their forte . . . but that food though!! I got the California Caterpipllar Roll which was a deep fried spam masubi with crab, spicy mayo, and ell sauce (if I rmemeber correctly.) YUM! I would come back just for this. It was so good.
This place is super good. I was born in Hawaii. You should trust my opinion. The food is the most authentic that I've had in a long time.

So i order from here frequently and so to write a bad review pisses me off more. I order the same thing every time. The Ahi salad. I order through uber eats because I work at a call center can can't leave. They forget the dressing which makes the entire salad. I call and the lady says "I'll note that." Okay you noting something doesn't help me to eat a dry salad. She was ready to end the conversation. Like that's it. It will be noted. No honey I can't eat a 18 dollar salad. I need a little more then that. They blame uber and say they should have checked it. So it's not your responsibility to put it in the bag. Absolutely frustrating with the level of accountability. Then she says when I order again in the future they will make sure to give me extra dressing for the dressing that was missed. Perfect. So for my next 18 dollar salad I can have extra dressing. I'll never order from here again.
The poke is fire the deep fried spam masubui are out of this world. The ahi Katsura Roll was next level , and the garlic chicken was kill. Try tho place out you won't be disappointed!

Really good food. Owners friendly. -2 stars because they NEVER ever have spam musabi. Usually they say "oh they run out fast" one time I came in even earlier like 12pm they'd already run out. How do you have a Hawaiian place open and run out of that? Make more duh. It doesn't even take a lot of time. I'm sure this isn't an issue for most people because spam musabi is like a Hawaiian local thing (even gas stations sell it in Hawaii) but honestly it's like an American goes to McDonald's and theyre told they've run out of French fries for the day. 

WTF!!!!!!!!!!!! Sorry I really love my musabis. It's the ultimate sidekick to their really good plate lunches. Too bad they never have it ......

Today was my first time at 808 mixed place. The restaurant is very clean. All of the employees are great! The service was better than I expected. 

The fried musubi is AMAZING. The price was only $3.25 and it was quite filling. It is like a combination of a fried sushi roll and musubi. 

I also had the garlic chicken. It was delicious. It was not greasy at all. 

I will definitely come back.
Had the mixed plate combo with Ono chicken and garlic chicken. They call it the Ono chicken because when you run out you'll say "oh no." The garlic chicken is also amazing

After we stopped at Poke Express we got our lunch here. I've been living in Texas for the last 3 yrs and was craving some local Hawaiian cuisine. I ordered the fried saimin w/teri beef, hubs had the firecracker chicken, and kids had spam musubi. It was very satisfying and delicious. Glad we found this spot. Now I need to find some laulau & poi...

This place is just like all the other Hawaiian spots in town.  The only thing that sets them apart is Uncle Willie's chicken special, and they hardly ever make it.  I understand it's a special, but I think they would get way more business if they made it a weekly thing.  I even heard many people asking for it last time I was there and were also disappointed it wasn't being served.  MAKE UNCLE WILLIE'S CHICKEN A REGULAR THING!

Edit: So after adding my 2 cents in on yelp, the people at 808 mixed plate actually listened!  they emailed me letting me know when their special uncle willy's chicken was going to be made.  We took the drive from Henderson (which was a lot better knowing they actually would have it) and had a delicious dinner.  It was so yummy, and I even heard more people order it while we were there (for a second, I thought I was the only one)  so thanks to the power of yelp, and the people at 808 hawaii mixed plate that take their reviews seriously!  I really appreciate it!  I can't wait to go

We stumbled upon this place because we were on our way to poke express. We figure this would be the perfect combination since we were missing Hawaii. 

The restaurant itself could be nicer, but it looks like any other l&l. The prices were decent. $10 for a mixplate....not too bad considering they give u big portions. 

My husband had the combination kalua pig and cabbage & beef stew. He didnt care for the kalua pig and cabbage, because a lot of it was just cabbage. I had their version of a zip PAC from zippys in Hawaii. I actually liked it. It was really close for me. I almost felt like i was eating a zip PAC. 

decent prices, the food was good (in my opinion), and the portions were pretty big.
One of my favorite local spots to go eat!!! I really love the ono chicken and the hamburger steak!!!

First time here thanks to Yelp, and I like it. The environment is nice and chill as well as the customer service. Food was delicious. Got the garlic chicken that everyone was raving about and it didn't disappoint. I would recommend it for a quick eat if you, like me, didn't feel like waiting at a loud packed restaurant.
We found us on yelp, and it is a fun Hawaiian style restaurant. The garlic chicken is great, short ribs are great and the macaroni salads great.  Is a fun place we recommend it.

I was reluctant to try Hawaiian food after my awful experiences at L&L BBQ. At L&L, the meat is cheap and the dishes are so salty  -- GARBAGIO!

However, after reading reviews on 808 -we decided to give it a try. WOW-- this place is great! My family and I tried the following three dishes:

1. BBQ chicken plate (GOOD!)
2. BBQ beef plate, (GREAT!) and 
3. Korean spicy wings ( UNREAL!). 


All three plates came with white rice and a macaroni/potato salad combo. Both the chicken and beef plates were not fatty, and cooked just right. I have never seen my wife completely finish her plate before.......IMPRESSIVE!

My dish was the Korean wings which were crazy good. They wings were so meaty, and cooked to perfection. I chose the spicy version which were sweet with a little kick of chile. TIP--- Get an extra side of Korean sauce to dip your wings in......

**** This is a family-owned business and everyone is so nice. They made sure to check on us throughout our lunch, and were so pleasant to talk to. I can't say enough good things about this place-- I love it here. 

Our lunch came out to $24.00 for three lunches and 1 fountain drink. Please go to this restaurant, and support this hidden gem.

This place is popular.  I waited in line for 10 minutes before I ended up walking out.  The line was almost to the door!  I don't think it's worth waiting that long.  In those 10 minutes, the line NEVER moved and I overheard a patron that had already been served that she wouldn't come back because she didn't "like this place".  So I ended up @ Teriyaki Madness a few doors down.

This place will knock your rubbah slippah off! 

I'm a BIG eater so I ordered a little bit of everything. I ordered the saimin, loco moco, garlic chicken, Korean chicken, garlic Mahi Mahi, ahi tofu pattie thing, and sesame chicken. I promise it wasn't all for me. I brought my family.

1. The restaurant was very welcoming. You could feel the Aloha spirit when you walk in.

2. The food was priced right on the money

3. The restaurant was very clean 

4.  The wait time was normal considering my large order

5. My favorite part, the food:
garlic chicken with mayo miso sauce- the chicken was marinated and had the right amount of flavoring. The mayo miso took it to another level. Very local comfort food with a gourmet twist. 

Loco moco- I'm not big on loco moco's, but when I seen one coming out of the kitchen, it literally called my name. The hamburger patty was thick and juicy. The brown gravy was homemade. Rich and flavorful. It's definitely a home run.

Saimin- it had a light broth which I liked. The noodles had a nice al dente chew to it. Great side to a perfect meal.

Garlic Mahi- my husband ordered it and was raving about it. I was surprised cause he's not a big fish eater. 

Ahi tofu patty- my mom ordered it and absolutely loved it.

Korean chicken- my husband likes chicken but never eats the battering or skin. I was surprised to see him clean the chicken off the bone.

Sesame chicken- we brought that home for later. While we watched a movie at home we tore that plate up like it was a food eating contest. The chicken was marinated  perfectly. On the sweeter side with scoop of rice and mac salad. YUM! 

I was wanting some dessert but they had sold out earlier in the day. My mom and brother was telling me there cakes are fabulous. I guess I'll just have to take another drive out to the NW to see for myself. All for yelp sake of course. That's they only way I could give a true review. LOL :)

The only negative is they don't have a location in Henderson. :(

This place is a must!

yummy and delicious hawaiian goodies. great for a spam musubi or a lunch plate. They even can make saimin to go for those cold chilly days when you just want some hot soup. Otherwise the korean bbq rib or loco moco plate is enough to make you food coma.
Somen salad was tasty and very filling.  The mixed plate also tasty and all meals will fill you up!  Great place to go!

Oh my god this place is so good. Really, save yourself some money and skip all the $60 Vegas buffets. Just a comment on Vegas food besides buffets-- or at least for this place-- so much food for so cheap!

I agree with all the other reviews and want to recommend the garlic chicken. It's not really garlic-y. I can't really describe it, but it's more like a sweet and sour chicken with some tangy miso dressing. SUPER BOMB. Just get it. I've never had Hawaiian food in my life, but it definitely blends in with my familiar Asian food norm. 

The other entree I got was the chicken katsu. I was a bit hesitant at first because there were so many other exotic options. Personally, it was a great choice for me, since the others said that the loco moco was too salty, and since it wasn't traditional Japanese curry katsu, I still got to try something new. 

Sides-- pick rice and salad. The other combo is mac and potatoes. If you get that, everything would just be too heavy (in my opinion).

808 is located up in North Las Vegas, at the corner of Craig and Revere. It's on the Southeast corner, in the same plaza as Big Lots and Poke Express. They claim to serve Hawaiian style food and it's the closest I've had here on the mainland, not counting my families cooking that is. 

When my mom and I walked in, the place was empty. Didn't bother me as we avoided a long wait for our food as my mom mentioned that during the rush hour, orders can take up to 30 minutes and longer. As we left, two big parties made their way in, so we were lucky in that regard. 

I opted for the Won Ton Saimin. My mom chose some fish plate. The noodles consistency was great and the broth was tasty. As for the won tons, the filling was a little on the stingy side and I felt the serving size was a little small for the price. However, overall, I liked it and I'll be back for more when I'm in the area and I'm hit with a craving. I didn't try my mom's dish so I won't comment on it other than to say she cleared her plate. Not much more need be said than that.

Took too long to review this place. I ordered to go some months ago: garlic chicken with miso mayo and loved every bit of it with white rice! I wasn't a fan of the macaroni salad though. There wasn't anything spectacular about it.

Very stoked that this restaurant is still here in north Las Vegas. I always come to 808 Hawaii Mixed Plate for their chicken katsu dish and for their spam musubi... It just reminds me of the deluxe spam musubi from 7-11 back home in Hawaii. I also love this restaurant for their Friday special and breakfast all day dishes too.
Amazing garlic chicken plate! I have been here a handful of times, and always get the same thing! Also have had the spam masubi, which is also very good.

I've gone to this spot for lunch twice now. Each time I ordered food to go, and left smiling. The staff is super friendly. It feels like you just walked into a Hawaiian family kitchen. 
By the time I got home, (less then 10 minutes) the food is perfect. Fried masubi is probably a sin somewhere, but I would recommend the risk. I've had the ago salad.  The tuna is beautifully rare, over an assortment of flavors and crisp greens. 
The mahi burger was a huge crispy and moist mahi steak with fresh veggies and some awesome tartar sauce. 
5 stars for sure.

Maybe I got here on an off day but I'm not impressed being from Hawaii there is a certain expectation and this place didn't meet it.  The plates are more expensive then most "Hawaiian" quick stops but they give 2/3 of the amount.  The garlic chicken sample was super good but the rest of the food was average.  Portuguese breakfast eggs scrambled - eggs terrible flavorless and not cooked through. Fried spam musubi no one said there is a nasty mayo sauce on it or we wouldn't have ordered it ruined the whole thing.  Hula pack was pathetic my sons were still hungry rice well made noodles tasteless but the bbq chicken was good just too little.  The somen salad looked good but didn't have enough sauce and had not real ham but sandwich ham cut up in it.  Again not someplace I would come across town for as I live in Henderson but it was ok.  Oh the place is really clean and the workers were nice which is why they got 3 stars.
Hands down the best place in Vegas for plate lunch.  The aunties there will make sure you are full.

First time in Vegas and tried out this local Hawaiian spot and it exceeded all my expectations! The food is great and the staff is friendly. 

I got a spicy poke bowl, fried spam musubi and a loco moco. They were all great but my favorite was the fried spam musubi. It was different and like a sushi roll. Definitely recommend!
The food here is amazing.  I always come here and order the kalbi.  Awesome portions & amazing flavor.

The food here is super tasty, portions are generous, and the staff is very courteous! I've never been to Hawaii, and haven't really wanted to go, but eating here makes me want to go just for the food!

I went to Hawaii for the first time a few months ago.  One of the best things about he trip was the amazing food.  Las Vegas is often called the 9th island because of the significant Hawaiian population here, which also comes with it an abundance of Hawaiian restaurants.  This place is the closest I have found to what I remember having in Hawaii!  The moco loco, katsu chicken, Kalua pork, and kalbi short ribs are all amazing!  Every time I am up in the neighborhood, I make sure to stop here for my fix!

You'll have to be prepared to wait a good 20-30 minutes for your food to come. I would suggest you call in and make a phone order. The garlic Ahi (grilled) was dry, even though I requested pink inside. A little pricey, but I guess you have to pay Hawaiian prices in the 702.

Awesome homestyle island food! The musubi and mac salad was okay but the meat was so flavorful and juicy. Love this place and it was definitely worth the 25 min drive out lol Service was good overall vibe of the restaurant was casual and homey.

Extremely disappointing. My family and I drove all the way from the bay area because a friend of mine recommended we try this place. She raved about it. I was not impressed. Out of all the Hawaiian spots I've been to 808 seemed to have really small portions and I was still hungry after and it was pretty pricey. I will say this the Beef was tasty that's about it.. Will I come back? Probably not.

Aloha 808.
Had the kalua pork with cabbage plate with Mac for a side. The pork was VERY juicy. Nice taste. I would have no problem eating here again. For those that care. The men's restroom was very clean.

This is one of our go to spots on Friday's or any other day I don't feel like cooking. We have order just about everything on the meun and our favorites are the garlic chicken and spicy poke. The service is always quick and friendly.

So much food!! I loved this place very much. I had ordered the famous garlic chicken and spare ribs mix plate with rice and macaroni salad. I was not a big fan of the mac salad only because of the potatoes and am used to L & L's version (mmmm). Also the spare ribs were a little tougher than expected, but everything else was very tasty! Next time I will definitely share a plate, the servings are more than enough for one person. Will stop by again when I get the chance.

The food here is ALWAYS good, and it doesn't hurt that it's very close to my house. My favorites include the kalbi short ribs, garlic chicken, and their somen salad. I'm constantly ordering their garlic chicken bowl, check it out people! Their kalbi is so flavorful but it's little on the pricey side right now, so I only get it every now and then. And I love their somen salad for when I'm craving something on the colder, refreshing side :)

I always go in at least once a week. The food is great and the boneless Kolbi is my favorite dish. The workers here are always helpful and try their hardest. They also have great shirts, I bought one for myself. Definitely authentic Hawaiian barbecue. LnL got nothing on 808 Hawaii Mixed Plate.
Love this place! Garlic chicken, the poke, butter Michi and cone sushi are like my absolute favorites here! It's a bit of a drive for me but it's well worth it!
Best Hawaiian BBQ in North Las Vegas. Their garlic chicken and short ribs  are incredible.

After eating here several times I am finally getting around to this review. Why, you might ask? I dont know why either. Maybe its because I am so full and satisfied after each visit that I just got too relaxed which equals to laziness on my part. Well I feel that I need to do this now so all you peeps out there looking for a decent Hawaiian place to eat can get the info you need. First of all, they are closed on mondays.  To help you find this place easier, look for the nicely sized Big Lots sign in the same complex. Since the building itself is kind of back a ways, their sign looks dinky from the street. They are to the right of Ella Em's Soul Food which I kind of dont recommend eating at. Refer to my review on them and you will know what I mean.

Since my first visit here I kept telling myself that I will try other dishes but always end up getting the same items. Mainly Kalbi Short Ribs, Garlic Chicken, and Grilled Mahi Mahi accompanied by a rotation of the Mac Salad and Green Salad.

First and foremost, if you are coming here for the first time, get the Kalbi Short Ribs! It is nothing like what you have had at other places. It's literally a bone in steak because the cut they give you is like about 4 actual short ribs stacked on top of each other but cut up into strips for you enjoy it much easier than having to manually pull the meat apart or cut it. If you dont believe me, please refer to the numerous mouth watering pics and mine will be there as well! I recommend you order it medium rare for best taste and tenderness.
