Also give them a little more time to cook it especially if the place is packed.

For you garlic lovers like me, the Garlic Chicken is what always gets me kind of like how that one really cute nephew or niece of yours that you just cant say no to when they tilt their head and give you the puppy dog eyes look. Its basically chicken katsu cut up but with a different version of breading with a garlic mayo type of sauce on it.

The grilled Mahi Mahi always hits the spot for me when it comes to my fish craving. Its tender flakiness falls apart oh so easily with your fork. Only thing that may have caught my attention is that the portion was just a tad small. 

These three items I get are part of the their name sake combo, the 808 Mixed Plate in which you choose two items accompanied with two scoops of steamed white rice and your choice of mac salad or green salad. Im glad I dont come here alone and bring my family instead so I can sample all the goodness! 

The total price for all three large orders plus 2 drinks came to about 31 bucks and change. FYI, most orders you can get a mini or large depending on your appetite. The 808 mixed plates are guaranteed to be large sizes. So I would say an average meal here would be around 10 bucks a person. Not bad at all for really good food and good service.

Speaking of service, they take your order at the counter, you pay, sit down,  and they bring it out to you once its done. The drinks are self serve so you dont have to wait for them to refill your drinks. Once you are done eating, try to at least clean up a bit after yourself so that they dont spend too much time cleaning after you and for Pete's sake, leave a decent tip if you havnt already when you paid up front.

Next time I will try to order other stuff but no promises. Also dont forget to check out Poke Express down a few suites for some excellent Poke and yes, I have a review for that place too! So what are you waiting for? Stop reading this while driving and go straight there. Then you can send me a compliment after reading this. Lol. Enjoy!

Yelp 2014 365 Review Challenge #105 "Da Kine!"

Their garlic chicken is AMAZING!!! We always get the 808 mixed combo plate with garlic chicken and spare ribs. I have not tried anything there that I didnt like. The staff is super nice and asked us if we had ever been there before the first time we went, when he said no they gave us a free sample of the garlic chicken. The spam masubi is good too; I dont know why it cost so much for one piece though, spam masubi is cheap to make. Regardless this place is awesome!

We just moved to LV last week & already missing the aloha spirit and food. Checked out YELP in hopes of finding a Hawaiian restaurant and came across 808 Hawaii Mixed Plate. Another Yelper reviewed the fire cracker chicken so I decided to try. It was so good; not your ordinary fried chicken drizzled with a mayo/sriracha sauce. Ono-licious  My hubby opted for the garlic chicken, which was good too. 
So, If you're looking for some out of this world Hawaiian food, this is the place to go.

I've been to 808 so many times I can't even keep track, but lately it's not really been worth it.  The place has a different vibe to it, not that it was super friendly before...but now it's worse.  I don't really recognize anyone.  The food is kinda the same, but the chicken seems very tough lately. I wanted the pork last time, but they were out so I got chicken.  This time I got chicken too.  I don't know if I am unlucky but both times I got something very hard, maybe a piece of bone?  My jaw even hurts.  I'm not wanting to speculate too much on what it was.  I also miss the specials.  I know they still have them, but they are the same every week.  Nothing "special".  I probably won't be back so much anymore, the prices and food don't really make it worth it.  :/

I had ordered The garlic chicken. I enjoyed it. It has this miso mayo that was really a good flavor added to the chicken. You can defiantly taste the garlic on the chicken but it wasn't over powering. It came with Mac salad which tasted like it was made couple days ago. I'm a Mac Salad fan and it really didn't taste that good. I think I should have ordered size Mini instead of regular because it is a large portion meal which is good.

The beau got the Loco Moco. The patty was made fresh and didn't taste like it came out of a freezer which he really liked. He did mention he wanted his eggs sunny side but he's egg came out over easy & yolk was cooked all the way. But other than that he enjoyed the food.

Honestly probably won't be returning. Nothing really wrong with the food. It's just nothing really stood out to me for me to return.

I am writing my review after my second visit.  Lets just say I spent $17 on take out and a soda and felt like it was a complete waste. I ordered the combination plate with shoyu chicken and Kalbi. It came with rice and macaroni salad.  The chicken was so dry like it had been stewing all day long. The Kalbi was thick cut (ordered the thin cut). It was fatty and chewy though tasted ok. The macaroni salad was soggy and sour. I ended up throwing it out. Needless to say I'll not be returning. I don't get the high reviews. 

They weren't friendly (not rude either). The dining room was grimy. I wondered how clean the kitchen was. 

If you think your gonna get the kind of plate lunch you'd get at L&L, it's not even close. I went to Juns the next day and got their combination and it was cheaper and tasted better.

Our favorite Hawaiian restaurant. Family run, food is always fantastic. They treat you like family. Prices have increased over the years but we still keep coming back to this joint. Worth the drive if you're not from the area.

Found this place by divine intervention!  First  sign of this being a good place, walked in and the place was slammed!  Second, menu had all the comforts of my island palate!  Third, the food was delicious and passed the Keiki test!  HI BBQ beef & chicken, Katsu, Teri beef burger and I mean Teri beef, not ground beef.  So good the old man had to order a second.  And the hurricane fries oh yeah!

I rolled into Las Vegas on Tuesday.  I had three days and a hundred and eighty-five bookmarks.  It was time to get busy.

I was hungry AF, and I wanted to try somewhere new.  808 Mixed plate was at the top of my list. What a great discovery!

Stepping up to the counter, I told the counterperson it was my first visit.  Then it got a little weird.  Without saying a word to me, she turned around a told the kitchen "Give me a garlic!"

Someone's To Go order had just come up and she grabbed it and started packing it up.  Meanwhile I'm standing there, a little confused.  Another counterperson was nearby and I tried to ask him a question.  He totally didn't hear me.  So I'm standing there for like a solid minute or two while everyone behind the counter is doing their behind the counter duties.

I've read about a million reviews that describe something similar.  Usually the customer just gives up  and leaves.  Then they go home and writes a scathing review of the customer service.   

But that would've been a douche move.  Super douchey.  I would've missed out on a really great meal.

Barely two minutes had passed when Joy, the counterperson, turned around and offered me a little sample cup.  "This is our Garlic Chicken," she explained, "this is what we're known for."

Garlic Chicken?  Who the hell wants Garlic Chicken?  I didn't come for Garlic Chicken.  I'm all about Katsu Chicken.  I don't even want to try Garlic Chicken.

But Joy is super cute, and like most men, I'll do just about anything for a smile from a cute girl.  So, I politely try the Garlic Chicken.

Holy hell, that sh$t is good!  "Wow!," I exclaimed.  Joy laughed at my reaction.  "It's kind of like I punched you in the face, isn't it?," asked Joy,  "No kidding," I replied.   I couldn't believe how good that garlic sauce was.  Joy explained about how it was made, something about garlic and mayo and something.  I can't remember exactly because talking to cute girls gives me amnesia.  And I had just recently been, like, punched in the face.

So, you know, I was on a mission to score some Katsu, and I needed to follow through.  But at the same time, I needed more of that creamy garlic sauce.  I asked about  getting a half katsu and half garlic chicken.  Joy said, no problem, you can get a half and half.

Now, if you are a dumb ass like me, you might think you're going to get a regular-sized order of food with half katsu and half garlic chicken.  But if you've been around the block, you know that a combo at a Hawaiian food place means two full orders of whatever it is you pick.  So when I pick up my food my eyes just about bug out of my head.  Dang, that's a huge pile of chicken!

You know how a dog's leg starts to shake when you pet it just right?  If there was a camera on me in that restaurant when I was there, I'm pretty sure the video will show some serious shaking.  

The Katsu and Garlic chicken are prepared a little differently than at other Hawaiian places I've visited.  The chicken isn't pounded flat.  The pieces more closely resemble actual pieces of chicken rather than flattened cutlets, or whatever.  The chicken isn't at all dry, like Katsu sometimes can be.  It's moist as a prom date and every bit as delicious.

The mac salad was atrocious.  I could only eat one bite.  The rice wasn't much better.  That's all I'm going to say about that.

They have a self serve Coca Cola machine, but no Mr. Pibb.  They have styrofoam cups, and I love me some styrofoam cups.  

I will definitely be back for more of that crazy good Garlic Chicken.  Thanks for turning me on to it, Joy!

Mikey C says: 808, baby!

Unless you're eating at Roy's or something, this will probably be one of the most expensive hawaiian mixed plates you'll purchase in life, but I think it's worth a try. I don't find myself in North Las Vegas very often, so my husband and I decided to go big with our orders. He got the market price kalbi and I did the market price mahi mahi. Both were cooked very well and to our specifications. You still get a very large portion of rice and mac salad. The servers were very sweet and were very helpful in helping me narrow down my order. The mahi mahi leftovers I took home were still good the next day and didn't have that offensive fish odor, so I could tell the fish they use is very high quality. It also came with a soy wasabi sauce that gave the fish that extra kick. The kalbi had the most delicious char which I even enjoyed, and I'm not a bit steak-eater at all. I had to remind myself of the food a bit while writing this review and currently salivating at the other menu offerings, so I do hope to return one day! Reminded me a bit of Helena's on Oahu, which I've really missed.

The BBQ beef was way too thin & over cooked to the point of dry not tasty jerky, the sesame chicken was super dry as well. My garlic chicken was okay although I specifically asked for the miso-mayo sauce on the side & it was spread on top, since the food took forever I did not want to wait for another 30 minutes just for them to make more dry ass  sesame chicken just to pretend it's garlic chicken with some fat gross mayo sauce on it. The spam musubi was eh... nothing to get your panties in a bunch for but the haupia dessert was absolutely divine... best I've ever had. Seriously my fellow Hawaiian ohana? This is what you consider da best on da 9th island? Ono?....More like oh no.
fabulous fabulous fabulous..oh did i mention fabulous!? mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm they said my review was to short doesn't fabulous say it all???!!!?

Brah, this place make some ONO kine dessert!    After some broke da mouth kine killa Misuken style fried chicken, I was kicking it with a opu that was nearly full to the max,   The Misuken style chicken was perfect, because it was crispy, but had one of the lightest batters that complimented a sauce what would have made anybody want a second serving....if you still have the room.

One thing for sure, since I live so far away from 808,  I never make it to 808 early enough to get some of their kick butt desserts, because they sellout within an hour on a few of them.   So I became a fan of this business on Facebook to see what kine specials come out, and I always see some mouth watering creations that spread out on their page.

On this day, I got more than my wish, and they broke out a custard pie that evening which just finished solidifying.    OH BRAH, that pie was better than Honolulu's Lee's Bakery and Sweet Revenge custard pie combine.    The crust was perfect, and was still flaky and light!   The custard was firm, and had a great  fresh egg taste.   I thought, 168 market put together a great egg tart, but 808's pie hit a grand slam with this pie!    I hope, I'm lucky enough to catch this again.

By far this is the go to spot for hawaiian food the gralic chicken is of the chain
Located up in north las vegas off mlk and craig next to big lots its worth the drive from across town
Finally got a chance to eat here. Food is delish, like others have mentioned. I had the Furikake Chicken and hubby had the Bento B plate. Both tasty and tender.

This place is really good the reason for my stars is because they are always closed before the time that's posted on there door.  Went there 3 times for them to be closed at 8 so today I decided to call so I wouldn't waste my time and gas again and she said they close at 9 and last call is at 8:45pm so I made sure to leave right away I got there at 8:10pm and they were closed the food is good but it's not worth having to deal with there horrible service/time management.

Classic Hawaiian in vegas, I would go back for sure.  Loved the Loco Moco and the food was very good.  Vibe is hippy dippy, and the booths in the restaurant make you feel like you are in an old mcdonalds or something strange, but the place packs em in, I cannot wait to go back , and also, in the same parking lot is the best little hawaiian poke shop in vegas, have lunch then get some pokey to go....mmmmm mmmm  4 star goodness!  Satisfying your taste for the islands....

It was a nice treat to find this hole in the wall restaurant!  I yelped for a place close to me because a friend passed by and did not want to go far. I actually found a different Hawaiian place not realizing it did not have any seating.  The young man at that first place recommended if we wanted Hawaiian there was a place a few doors down. We were so glad it turned out to be excellent food and service.  I ordered a combo plate, with Mahi Mahi(I choose grilled vs. fried) and garlic  chicken.  I choose the garlic chicken because the young lady taking our order said it was their most popular dish.  I did not realize it was fried until I got plate. I typically dislike fried food but this was done well so I was not disappointed.  The Mahi Mahi was excellent and fresh!  I got a salad and it was good, the only complaint I have is that they were heavy on the sesame oil. Their sauces were very tasty.  I thought the prices were high but the portions were well worth it. I also do not like ordering at a counter and then having a seat, too bad they do not have waiter service.  I would return though.
I got the garlic chicken and kalbi ...they both had great taste the bad thing was my kalbi was all fat :( mac salad was blah this was take out next time we will try dine in

3.5 Good eats, but Island Flavor is still my #1 and only in LV! Okay, for when you can't drive down to that part of town, this is a good alternative to get your 808 fix in. Poke Express is also a few doors down if you want something lighter.

Lots of island kine eating here, so you know there's gotta be something legit about it. Lots of options from beef stew ranging to classics like katsu and kalbi.

Their take on things is different than Island Flavor, so worth a shot to see how people do things differently. (I'm incredibly partial to Island Flavor's Furikake chicken, though. Here it is dark meat fried and then cut into strips.)

Prices are decent, but ordering a combo plate with short ribs will set you back $16 or $17! Big portions, but I can still find tastier, better quality for less down on Durango Drive.
D E L I C I O U S. I had the garlic chicken and the pulled pork! The food was well worth the drive and money. I also had the hurricane fries. Two thumbs up!

I Love This Place.Their Fried Spam Musubi Is A Must! 808 Is Military Friendly And Gets A Little Packed During Lunch Time. Its  A Good Idea To Call Ahead And Order Your Food Because It Does Take Awhile To Cook. 

-You Must Get The Garlic Chicken!!!!!

Great food and service, fresh to order food, clean, good size portions... Overall, a great small Hawaiian restaurant! Our favorite is the garlic chicken plate. Must go and check it out. You won't regret it.
Awesome food! I go to Oahu every year and I am pretty sure the mac salad at 808 is better than Rainbow drive in Mac salad. The chicken katsu, BBQ chicken and short ribs were super tasty too!

I love the Kalbi and Garlic Chicken plate, my complaint is that it is more on the expensive side so we don't come here very often and there aren't enough seats in the very small restaurant to eat during the lunch or dinner rush so we end up having our food made to go. Sometimes the people working seem kinda irritated  & on those days it's probably best to take the food to go or turn around and go somewhere else.

My husband and I decided to make 808 are main spot for our weekly lunch dates. So we've been there at least 10 times. However, today was one of those days were we needed to relax and enjoy each other's company and food. Nope,my Kalibi ribs were hard to chew and the Ono chicken was so very hard to bite. I was told by the waitress that her boss (owner) said I should've told them before I picked at it and they would've replaced my meal. But, it's too late. The waitress also informed me that she's been getting complaints from other customers as well. Oh okay, you've just lost a customer. Way to go!

Best Hawaiian food in Vegas!!! Though it can be a wait to get your food, it is soooo worth it. I used to love L&L but this place really is better. If you are ever in the North Las Vegas area... take a detour and come here. I always do :).
This place is BigTyme! If you one local or like local food then this da place to come! Garlic chicken is a must as well as the whole menu! They got much Aloha!

Delicious. I have been craving the garlic chicken all week. It was so good, I need to tell everyone that I know that they have to go and eat some of the garlic chicken that changed my life.
Ok, not really changed my life, but made me sad that I don't live closer to enjoy the yummy dishes that are offered at this friendly shop. 
I ordered the $5 Bento: rice, couple pieces of kim chee, spam and garlic chicken. Crispy, juicy, salty and sweet. Oh my, what a combination. It was the perfect size for my smaller appetite ( I also needed to save room for gelato).
My husband had a bigger plate that included ahi, chicken, rice, fried saimin and spam. He ate all of his food-cleaned his plate! 
I am picky about my rice, I like it cooked a certain way, I call it fatsy... super sticky without being mushy. If a place serves rice that is no where near my fatsy scale, it is immediately on my SL. This place serves rice that is perfect. I could have just eaten rice and been happy. 
While we were eating, a lady came by to talk to us about our food. I love service like this, it lets the customer know that the people that are serving the food really want to know if you enjoy what you are eating and makes you feel like you are more than just a customer. It sends a message to the patron that the business cares.

Enjoy, the garlic chicken!

I've been here too many times to count. It's excellent. I recommend it to everyone who's asking where to go for lunch.

My favorite is the firecracker or garlic chicken. Getting a mixed plate of that is perfect. The loco moco is fantastic too.

If I had to find something wrong, it would be they're not open enough. I always find myself pulling in to late after they've closed. Like, I know they need to sleep, but why can't I get my amazing cheat food at 3 am?

I love this place.  The food is incredible and the customer service is awesome.  The mom there knows my favorites by heart and I believe she takes pleasure in feeding me lol.  She reminds me of my mom always bringing me food with a smile on her face.  I hope it's not rude that I don't know her name.  They don't wear name tags.  Everyone is super cool though.

We just moved to this side of town and we are already addicted. They garlic chicken is on fire! It's only 10 bucks you get the chicken your rice and chose of mac salad or tossed salad. As of right now we have been coming all week --- super duper good ......... must try!
The staff are always friendly. I always order for pick up. Fast service and the food is always delicious. Kalbi ribs are Mmmm Mmmm good.

I don't know how I feel about this place, because I love that it's a mom & pop kind of spot. The service was very nice. However, for the price & quality of food... I definitely could've made this stuff at home. It didn't have much flavor in my opinion. 

I'll have to go back& try it again, maybe it was the dish I ordered, not the food. But my husband and I felt the same way about it & we ordered different things. 

So not sure if I'll be back anytime soon. 
Pricey and dull flavor. But I want to support their local business. 
This was a tough one

One of my top 5 favorite places to eat in town ! I don't even want to tell you how ONO  "delicious"  the Korean style chicken wings are! My fave grinds! But really anything anytime I've ordered it's all good! The owners and employees are all  so awesome chill! Aloha loa nui!

Ok if anyone's seen my other reviews for places I don't give a 5 star lightly. I take into account price, quality, and quantity. We accidentally stumbled into this place because poke express was closed. It was fate intervening and wanting us to try this little piece of Hawaii in Vegas. I had the mixed plate with Kalbi and garlic chicken. My husband had the moco loco and katsu chicken...we also got a taste of the Uncle Willy's katsu and cream puff made of Okinawa potato and chantilly cream...my mouth is watering again just talking about it. The Kalbi wasn't the usual thin piece of meat...the meat was thick, juicy, and I had more meat than rice to eat with!  The uncle willys katsu was crispy and a little bit honey. My friends bought two servings to go it was so delish! I know this is going to sound insane...but their food is better than any Hawaiian food I had in Hawaii...ok minus the macademian pancake and garlic shrimp food truck. I'm so happy that I don't have to fly 12 hours to Hawaii to get good Hawaiian food! It's now only 6 hours away and here in Vegas :)

I'm not one to right a bad review because they are subjective. But...

I'm no restaurant expert but the so called service was completely terrible. It was my first and last time here and ONLY because it was close to my home. I usually go to Aloha Kitchen for Hawaiian food. 

When asking about menu items I was given an attitude as if was supposed to know what it was. Eventually after getting a short answer I just agreed and ordered the Kau Kau "pack" with seared ahi because they were out of salmon and bbq chicken. 

The ahi was good, saimin was probably sitting all day, the chicken was dry and half burnt. My musubis were brought and placed on the table which had not been wiped down I know this because the stains were still there it, note that it's was the cleanest table I could find.

After spending over $40 including a generous tip I left very unsatisfied with the service. I honestly expected more since it had a mom and pop feel and great reviews... Later 808.

Omg so many items on their menu. I wished that I could order everything.   Breakfast is served all day  

Okinawiian sweet potato coco puff in the fridge by the sodas. Mmmmm I wished I wasn't doing errands all day or else I would of gotten some. 

So many choices that I couldn't decide what to get the fried saimin with garlic chicken because a lot of the reviews said it was the best. Boy am I glad I did. It was sooooo good. Reminded me of home. The portion was huge and I hardly made a dent in it. The garlic chicken had some kind of garlic mayo over it. I think next time I may ask for it on the side. The chicken was very flavorable. The fried saimin was so ono. 

I will definitely be back and want to try the garlic ahi.

I've never actually been to the restaurant but I've order delivery from this place about 5 times so far, and I have to say, I like this place better than a few other popular known Hawaiian themed restaurants in the Las Vegas area.

I actually love the different bentos, my go to bento would be the 808. Spam, bbq chicken, teriyaki beef, fried salmon and rice. I usually order a side of Kim chee and mac/potato salad as well. 

For a quick lunch while your working, this is definitely a fave of mines

The ultimate is the Kalbi short ribs plate. It's $16.00 but it comes with rice and a side salad, but the Kalbi is cut so thick, you're going to love this plate! Especially if you're like me and have a Hawaiian sized stomach!

Today, I ordered the garlic chicken combo plate with bbq chicken - WOW!

The garlic chicken sort of reminds me of mochiko chicken with a nice garlic aioli.

Folks, if you love Hawaiian BBQ, you can't go wrong with this place. The food is yummy and the portions are just right.

Check out the food, order take out or delivery and enjoy some good Hawaiian style bbq!

:)

Their food is delicious ! Me and my husband went for the first time about 2 days ago, we never seem to agree on food and this place definitely had us both agreeing. We both thought their food was on point super fresh and the flavors were amazing. I'm not to educated on this type of food and the lady behind the counter that was taking the order had a lot of patience with me, which I appreciate a ton! I had the furkaki ahi plate?  I know i must have misspelled it but it was seard Ahi with a tasty sauce drizzled ontop. 5 stars for the food! The atmosphere could use a lil work though.  Ill definitely be returning
One of my favorites and best tasting but the portions seem to keep getting smaller and smaller.... it's not like it use to be.

They opened around 11:05. We were the first customers for the day and the moment we came in no one greeted us or even smiled as we came in. There were two ladies upfront and no one even bothered to ask whether we were ready or needed help. Even after we greeted them good morning, the lady at the cashier just stared at me and did not even respond with a smile. I would probably understand if it's the end of the day and they are already tired but... The same thing happened to the customer after us..... 

Anyway for the food we ordered the loco moco and kuakua plate (?) 

The loco moco gravy was bland and watery. It was lacking so much flavor which is essential to the loco moco experience. :( the patties were so much thicker than the traditional loco moco and kind of dry. :( I have travelled to hawaii and had hawaiian food all over southern california and sad to say I never had a bad experience with hawaiian food like this. 

The macaroni salad was alright. I usually finish two cups of those but this time the most I could have was 2 spoonfuls of it. :( 

I have not tried their whole menu because they might have some specialties that could taste great but sadly I am never coming back.... $30 for 2 people was too much for that quality :(

Came in looked the menu over for an "In-between Church Services Meal". No idea what I wanted. The beautiful cashier suggested the Garlic Chicken they were known for. After several questions she got me a sample. The sauce was FIRE in a good way and the Miso Mayo was sweet. After ordering and picking grilled instead of Fried chicken with the sauce from the Garlic Chicken on the side, I realized I literally had 3 servings of Chicken Teriyaki with brown rice at home and JUST left a place because I didn't want to spend $10 for the same thing I had at home. I apologized and asked her to cancel the order.  She did so kindly and encouraged me to come back. 4 stars for EXCELLENT customer service. Hoping to add the 5th star when I finally try the food one day.

Always super delicious but then I always get the same thing~ 808 mixed plate with kalbi (shortribs, med-rare~) and garlic chicken. There's also enough food to where I always have enough for a second meal.

Have tried other Hawaiian places in the North Las Vegas area and they just don't compare~

This is just an abbreviated review since we came here because we were squatting their tables and we were referred by Poke Express a couple of doors down.  We didn't want to be completely jerky about it so we ordered a couple of Spam Musubis http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/808-hawaii-mixed-plate-north-las-vegas?select=iGmvCpBb7NpMCPh4ILBcyw#iGmvCpBb7NpMCPh4ILBcyw and a Somen Salad http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/808-hawaii-mixed-plate-north-las-vegas?select=iGmvCpBb7NpMCPh4ILBcyw#R-2jbUYQ6EjnDKAIe0LMFQ to go along with our spoils that we brought from PE...

The girls had the salad mostly and they said it was alright.  The Spam Musubi were fine.  I honestly don't know because I didn't actually try anything else but I've been to Aloha Specialties and this place seems to rate favorably...

Nice to know that they're good neighbors with Poke Express...

Enjoyed the chicken dishes, especially the Ono chicken. Really crispy! They have some local specials like Loco Moco, etc, and was told that they sell out pretty fast.  Macaroni salad is solid, and enjoyed the kahlua pork and Garlic chicken too.

It's nice that they participate in Restaurant.com coupons.
Been here quite a number of times and ordered the mixed BBQ plate. Ive tried their garlic chicken, galbi ribs, furikake chicken, firecracker chicken, ahi poke, and chicken katsu. All were great!

Stopped by after some last minute Halloween shopping at a nearby party store. From what I can see from their menu, this is not your typical hawaiian BBQ place with all the same typical plates and combos. This one had a bunch of stuff I've never heard of and it took me a while to figure out what I was going to order.

I didn't wanna ask questions because they'd probably look at me weird for not knowing what a certain item was (people think I'm islander all the time). So I played it cool and ordered something called a pack? But they ran out of packs for the day so they subbed the noodles for rice and macaroni salad instead.

Let me tell you, the 3 mile drive home from that place felt like the longest drive of my life! After taking a peek and a whiff of my box at the first stop sign, I couldn't wait to get home and tear this thing up. And it was good. I had BBQ beef and chicken katsu and both were delicious. Their food has that home cooked touch to it that you don't get at the other Hawaiian BBQ places. I'm really glad I went with them when I decided to cheat on my diet. Can't wait to try the other dishes that my fellow yelpers recommend on my next cheat day...which will probably be tomorrow.

This is my new Hawaiian spot!

all the reviews mentioned the garlic chicken and man it was delicious! i added noodles and wow it had bacon in it! amazing noodles, bbq chicken is great. the bbq beef should be sliced.

i will be back for sure!

also regarding customer service i told them this was my first time and asked many questions. they answered them all without any attitude.

During a whirlwind trip to Vegas recently, my friend, a Vegas local, took me to this spot.  It's very synonymous with L&L in California, both in name and theme.

The fast food restaurant was very ordinary and what you'd expect.  Simple bench seats, a front counter and a kitchen area.  No frills at all.

The employee working here lacked any sort of personality, to the point of appearing offended that we were in her business ordering. Later on, she warmed up, but it was an odd feeling like she hadn't really ever dealt with more than 1 person at a  time, ever.

**FOOD!**

The food was tasty.  Chicken and beef plates, but unlike Cali, none include the Kalbi Ribs, as everywhere else does.  I asked if they had these, they said yes, but it was a large amount of $$ more, and an extra 15 minute wait, so I declined.  

Overall, if I'm visiting Vegas, I'll probably stick to the tastiness on The Strip and eat this type of food in Cali.

The Kalbi (short ribs) were awesome... Their sweet potato pancake was delicious. The BBQ beef, not so exciting. Was sort of dry and tough to chew. Otherwise this is a cool little Hawaiian restaurant in Vegas. Would come again for breakfast or short ribs.

The best local food I have had in Vegas so far.  The quality of the food and the preparation is outstanding.  I have been there 3 times in the past month and everything I have tried was unbelievably tasty.  It is a good thing that this restaurant is way up north or else I would be there way too often and eating my weight in garlic chicken.

The first dish I had was the garlic chicken.  This dish is a must try.  Juicy and flavorful breaded chicken with miso mayo right on top.  So delish.  The chicken is similar to Mochiko chicken with the sweet teriyaki flavor in the breading.

The Shoyu chicken was good as well.  Extremely large portion with 4 chicken thighs soaking in the sweet sauce.  Reminded me of Rainbow Drive In on Oahu.  

I most recently ordered the Mahi Mahi plate lunch from their specials menu.  It is usually sold out so I had to order it when I saw it.  The fish is lightly breaded and you get the choice of garlic sauce or furikake crusted.  The furikake style was delicious and I really want to try the garlic sauce.  I think the garlic sauce is the more popular option.

I tried some of the beef teriyaki and that was prepared well too.  Thin strips of beef marinated with teriyaki sauce and barbecued to perfection.  

Everyone that works here is so nice.  It is run by a family and the daughter always mans the counter while her older brother cooks in the back with their mom and dad.  I believe that there are aunties and other relatives that cook as well.  Very cute!

I realized 3 visits in that they offer military discount!  10% off would have saved me some money.  At least now I know.  I guess my biceps weren't big enough for her to ask if I was military.  Gotta hit the gym.

PS. I like to hit up Poke Express in the same plaza to eat some delicious ahi or salmon poke with my meal.  Makes it official... best meal ever.

I am not sure how this restaurant got 4/5 stars. I rarely post on yelp but after eating here, i felt i had an obligation to write an honest and truthful review. We ordered the 808 plate and the saimin noodles. Imagine eating top ramen with salty broth with pcs of an omelet. They were supposed to put pork but the lady said they didnt have any and placed cheap tasting ham bits. The first bite on that chicken was horrible. Half cooked and cold drizzled with "sauce". And the ribs, :( be careful everyone.

Don't know what all the fuss is about!! I've been in this town for over 20++years. I've seen plate lunch places come and go. 808 has the best flavors hands down to any other plate lunch place in the 702 area. I've never ordered anything that I've been disappointed in. My only problem is that they are 20+minutes away from my house. I especially love their kalbi (pricey but totally worth it), chicken katsu, and garlic chicken. Try it if you are new...you will be happy you did

First time here.  I wasn't sure what to get.  Sure, I'm from the islands but I don't have that one particular go to comfort food.  I asked the waitress what she recommended and she suggested the Garlic Chicken so I went with it.  I thought it was really good.  The chicken was full of flavor and moist.  It had some kind of sauce drizzled on top which added to the goodness of the meal.  It was good. I'd order that again! 

So with that being said, Happy Eatings!
Great homemade dishes.  Our garlic chicken and firecracker chicken were amazing!  Too bad they were out of the kalbi.

Bomb Diggity!!! The staff was friendly and even gave us garlic chicken to try and it was soooo Yummy!!! Thanks 808 HMP Team! You guys are awesome!!! Garlic Chicken/Kalbi plate was really good! Deep Fried Spam Musubi is also yummy!!!
taste like home! I had the garlic chicken and it was fanatic! my son did the combo with Loco moco and futikaki chicken and we both shared fried saimin! Everything was great! #hawaiiangrinds

Had high hopes.   Asked for poke, none today.  OK, let's go with chicken.  Oops, everything except for teriyaki was deep fried.  Teriyaki was OK, but not exactly Hawaii.  More like KFC than mixed plate.

Best Hawaiian food I've eaten in Vegas. Reminds me of being back on the islands.  Good portions, amazing flavors. Definitely will be back, this will be the only place I come to get Hawaiian food from now on for sure.

Enjoy something different, Hawaiian food was right down the road. Did take out and was glade to find this, spare ribs and garlic chicken along with white rice.  This place will be on my list of possible weekend stops.

I ordered the furikake chicken and teriyaki chicken combination. I was super disappointed with the furikake chicken. It was just chicken katsu with some seaweed sesame seed sprinkled on it. I was hoping something more crunchy like what they serve at Island Flavor. I was hoping this could be my new hawaiian place since it's a lot closer to home, but oh wells.

After Earl and I volunteered at Three Square, we were hungry.  Since we are barely in the North side of town, we decided to try out an eatery that we cannot visit often in Henderson.  We decided on 808 Hawaii Mixed Plate.

When we arrived, there was a group of guys in front of us.  Their orders came out and majority got the garlic chicken.  In addition, the portion looked huge.  Earl and I decided on the 2 meat combo.  We got the Kahlua pork and cabbage, as well as the garlic chicken.  It came with a scoop of rice and choice of mac salad or green salad.  We opted for the green salad.  The food came out after 10 minutes.  The Kahlua pork and cabbage was very tasty.  Just the right about of seasoning.  The garlic chicken was super flavorful.  It was crispy, sweet, and a bit spicy.  The mayo aioli was a great addition to this chicken.  The green salad had some brown, due to the old lettuce.  Was not very fresh.

Overall, the food was good and cheap.  One plate was more than enough for both Earl and I.  We will visit when we are back to volunteering at Three Square.

Can't go wrong. Good flavor. Good portion. Good pricing.
Just sucks that its soooo far.

My family and I came to this Hawaiian eatery for lunch. We ordered Musubi Spam,Korean chicken wings,Kalua roast pork,Furikake Mahi Mahi, & Sauted Shrimp. I must say all of these were amazingly good. It is a very casual place, you order your food on the counter and the waitress will bring the food to your table.Only my second time eating Hawaiian food and I know it's going to be one of my regular place to dine.

The chef here is amazing. Try one of his fish dishes. The sauces are better than most fine dining restaurants here in town. If you have a sweet tooth and are lucky enough to go to 808 when the okinawan sweet potato cream puff is available make sure to get it. You'll find aome of the best local food anywhere right here.

I waited years to try this place, I love Hawaiian food.  This place is a dream come true. I get mixed plate with kalbi beef and BBQ beef.  Spam musubi was good too.  Can't wait to go here again and again.
The food is CONSISTENTLY amazing. Keep up the great work 808 MP! I'll always come back until my doctor tells me not to.

There's a first time for everything...for the first time, we finally tried 808 Hawaii Mixed Plate. We enjoyed it so much on our first visit, we went back again a couple of days later. Aunty Norma is the one in charge of the kitchen with her son(I think), and Jocelyn runs the front, taking orders and serving guests. They are so nice and really make us feel at home always making sure our orders were up to par.

 So far, we've tried their Garlic Chicken, Furikake Ahi, Fried Saimin, Somen Salad
BBQ Fries, and Kalua Pig and Cabbage which were all so ONOLICIOUS!!! Yes there
can be a wait at times, but it is worth it. at least I know my food is made to order and not sitting in a warmer or under a heat lamp.

We will most definitely be back, especially to try their Lau Lau plate on Fridays and other ono grindz!...ALOHA!!!!

YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(279/365) "808 is GREAT!!!"
No wait this morning. Awesome! We had fried saimin,  musubi, maki sushi, loco loco, fried rice special, saimin and everything was delicious! Beats IHOP 2 hour wait time any day

It's amazing (and great) that there is such a large community of transplanted Hawaii folks in Las Vegas,  we don't refer to Vegas as the 9th island for nothing.  I was here over the holidays and got a chance to eat some pretty tasty food just like you'd get in da islands.

First thing when stepping inside the restaurant is that it "feels" like you're home in Hawaii, I swear it felt just like I stepped into an L&L or a LocoMoco drive in.  The next thing i noticed was everyone that was eating in there were ALL former Hawaii residents, all talking to each other,  talking about where they when grad from, where they moved from, etc.  It's really cool that there's like this network of "locals" far from home.

For our food, I had to try the deep fried spam musubi.  I just love the one at Da Kitchen on Maui so wanted to see how it compared.  The 808 HMP version is pretty awesome.  It has a really good crunch from the panko and I was happy that the coating adhered nicely to the musubi.  My only con about it was the musubi had a bit too much going on with the teriyaki sauce and the sriracha-mayo that was on it, the sauces overpowered the flavor a bit too much.

I also ordered a garlic chicken bowl, this was also good.  Not as good as the garlic chicken you'd get at places Sugoi or Mitsuken but reminded me more of the Yum yum chicken at aiea bowl or the Korean chicken at Zippy's, which isn't a bad thing.  The chunks of chicken thighs were cut a bit smaller which made it a bit easier to eat.  I'd say the sauce is more on the teriyaki side instead of the garlic side.

Aunty at the counter that took our order (I think she was the owner?) came over and asked how everything was.  I told her if I lived here, I would definitely be hitting this place up a lot.  It's a nice piece of "home" while being away.

Vegas has a lot of Hawaiian joints. I'm from the Bay Area, where we don't have too many (not as much as Vegas at least). So all I can compare this to is l&l or Hawaiian drive in BUT I WILL SAY this place was bomb. Ordered the garlic chicken, which is one of the more well known dishes, it was good! Lots of flavor and the chicken was cooked well

I'm now a huge fan of this place! Everything we tried was excellent. Garlic chicken, wow! Kalbi was perfectly seasoned and cooked. Even the humble scoop of mac salad was great! Highly recommended if you're in the area! Do they have one of these in LA?!?

This place is like a cheap whore with a heart of gold: shabby, well-worn, but run with love and with great prices. Lots of people pay a visit too. 

I only came because Poke Express, my go-to poke spot down the street is now closed on Wednesdays. I had been meaning to try the loco moco at this spot but I had a poke craving so I decided to go with it and order here. 

Though I love my raw fish spicy with light dressing (maybe kimchi and sesame oil), when I asked about their spicy poke bowl I was told it was sriracha mayo and masago mixed together, which is on the heavy side and very American to my taste. I went with it, ordered a side of shoyu, and I was pleasantly surprised at the taste when I got to try it. 

Though the dressing is a LOT and heavy, it went well. Wasn't spicy whatsoever so I sprinkled some of my own spicy chili flakes and furikake on it. I went with the salad, which was a lot and simple, but ate it with rice as well. The fish was smothered in sauce so I couldn't comment on how fresh it looked, but it was cut into perfect sized cubes and didn't taste old or weirdly soft, so there's that. I wish it came with more stuff in it, like green onions, or furikake, or something, but I get it, and for the price it was well-worth it. 

 Overall, I'd come back to try the loco moco, and maybe pick this if I had a craving for heavy poke.

If you haven't been to 808 Hawaiian Mixed Plate then now is the time to do so. This place offers a variety of choices you would want. I ordered the firecracker chicken with sauce. I was surprised to have furikake and made my experience even better to relish. Don't skip on musubi which they have it deep fried.

Garlic chicken all da way! 808 is so amazing and the service is always wonderful! I love coming here because they show you the aloha spirit and makes me feel like I'm back home in Hawaii. I've never had a better garlic chicken and always want to try something else, but it's hard to step away from a favorite until I took the step to just try the deep fried musubi and fried saimin. In definitely a fan!
Best Hawaiian food in the 702! And the owners and employees treat you and make you feel like home!!

Def the place to go for local food. I think the food has gotten worse over time though. It's not as good as it used to be. I usually order the Katsu chicken plate and spam musubi. Last time i got it, the Katsu chicken was soggy instead of crispy!! And the spam musubi was cold. Some days the food will be great and some days its the total opposite!! So good luck I guess lol
I always get the mixed plate with garlic chicken, and it is nothing short of amazing. Great prices, great portions, and delicious food.

My husband and I were staying at the Sante fe our last of 5 nights in Vegas. When I searched restaurants 808 came up. We are huge fans of Hawaiian and it's non existent where we are from. He got the Bbq chicken and the garlic chicken and I also got Garlic chicken and the Kalua Pork n Cabbage. Everything was delicious! The Mac the make is bomb too! We probably would of driven up from the strip more while we were here if we'd known about it sooner!

Tried 808 for the 1st time 2 days ago! I was a bit taken back at the price of the Kal-bi ribs... $17.95, but the meat was at marketplace prices, so very fair. My husband really liked it and it was a huge portion and cooked correctly- well done. I had the hamburger steak which unfortunately was under cooked, but gravy was great like the kind back home in Hawaii. I just cooked it until it was pau (finished) in the microwave. You can have with or without the onions and mushrooms. I had it with. I was really bummed because the extra Mac salad I ordered I never got, but paid $2 for. Only noticed after i got home! So my husband who likes 2 got mines. I had a bite of it and it was really Ono. The girl at the counter was super nice and the staff cooking was full of Aloha. One of them even ran down to Poke Express to get the last bag of poi!  Now that's customer service! Mahalos! I did not try the Musubi but a family who came in after me, scarfed them down and then ordered more. So you know it's good! This place is really good and super friendly!

Oh yah!  Because we accidentally ordered 3 orders of the deep fried spam musubi (which is about 18 pieces), I balanced it with ahi tuna on a bed of greens.  YUS, the loco moco looked astounding and so was everything else.  The hidden mouth-treasure is in their homemade shortbread cookies ;)

OK so the food here was good. But pretty overpriced, in my opinion. The kal bi special was TWENTY DOLLARS. No joke. TWENTY. It was ten bucks for a poke bowl. Don't get me wrong, it tasted terrific, but damn. 

And then the service, yikes. The cashier missed an item in our order. When we pointed out that it was missing, she snapped, very rudely, "Well, I  repeated your order to you, and you said it was right."

Then she just...walked away. OK...

If everyone didn't already have their food except for my one daughter, I would have left on the spot. Instead, we had to stand back in line and re-order the missed item. 

With all the other Hawaiian food options around here, I'm pretty sure we won't be back.

So I'm here visiting family, and was craving a snack. I had their DEEP FRIED musubi... WOW. I even ordered it as a takeout and it stayed crunchy while it sat in the takeout box! The flavors, the sauce, right amount of rice.... reminded me of a Godzilla roll but with spam. Yum yum yum! Can't beat the price either.

It's good but not great. 

-The pok had too much cream for my taste

-Furikake chicken tasted exactly like katsu chicken. We even thought we got the wrong order.

-Firecracker chicken just didn't have a special kick or any flavor that really stood out.

-The white rice has little bits of seaweed on it which was surprisingly good!

All in all, it's a cute spot ran by very friendly people but the food won't either wow or upset you. It's just...fine. I would probably not go back. Check out Island Flavor for Hawaiian food. They're absolutely the best!

we came here to eat the poke we bought at poke express, but wanted to be courteous and buy something here for letting us sit down and eat. we got spamasubi which we didnt try until several hours later. they were really good!! not too salty and with just the right amount of flavoring and rice. wish we had gotten more!

Don't place an order To Go without checking your food first!! I ordered the garlic chicken plate & a deep fried spam musubi. Both were extremely dry and had little to no sauce. Super disappointed with the quality of this order.

2 words, GARLIC CHICKEN! I found this awesome Hawaiian joint through Yelp and I'm sure glad I did because the garlic chicken is absolutely delicious. I don't live in the area, but I do work 10 minutes away so I've gone here once on my lunch break and another time after work. The chicken is amazing with breading almost identical to mochiko chicken. The garlic sauce is described as being "miso garlic" and isn't too overwhelming garlicy. They add chopped green onions to the top which give it a little bit of extra crunch and flavor. I may try the other items on the menu, but I have a feeling if I do I might say I should of gotten the garlic chicken because it's just that good. This place is legit because one of the times I came in most of the patrons eating looked like legit Hawaiians. They deserve 4.5 stars and I was thinking of raising it up to 5, but once the inside smelled like antibacterial which is very unappetizing (yuck!). I also introduced 808 Mixed Plate to my co-worker and she's been here more than me because she is in love with the garlic chicken too. This place might even be better than Island Flavor on the southwest side of town? As the Hawaiians say it, the chicken "broke da mouth.."

Most Hawaiian places have the usuals: loco moco, chicken katsu, spamasubi, etc. The nice surprise from this place was the garlic chicken.

Sometimes it's hard to stray from what you know will be good. I was very tempted by the loco moco, because it's hard to be disappointed.

They give a lot of chicken. At first, I thought they give you too much because the chicken part was super full, but then I looked under and it there was rice. Usually such a trick would sadden me, but this time I was actually happy. Mostly because I like rice with my meat and the ratio seemed off at first.

The chicken was somewhat sweet. It was a good sweet, and nicely cooked.  It went really well with their spicy mayo sauce.

I have been eating at this restaurant a few years now, it is always great and made fresh to order. The Garlic Chicken is so amazing I have to eat it at least once per week. yummmm   If you like salad too, you can get almost any dish made into a salad or served with rice.

This might be my favorite spot for a bite to eat in North Las Vegas so far.  

I ordered the mixed plate which comes with two meats of any kind on the menu, rice and salad (either macaroni or side greens). For my two meats, I chose the garlic chicken and the BBQ chicken.  I opted for the side salad instead of the macaroni salad and it came with two well-portioned scoops of sticky rice. 

As per the other reviews, the garlic chicken came highly touted, and rightfully so.  It was crispy and wasn't overly potent with garlic flavor. The BbQ was really tender (thigh meat) and juicy.  It was drizzled with sauce, but a little more "charred" taste would've made it better.  The rice was cooked perfectly to my liking, and the salad was... well, a small side salad with dressing. Not bad, not good. I did like the spiral-cut carrots.

Amazing food, the aunties are very welcoming and polite.  It is a bit small, I hope more people go so they can get enough funds to expand!  

It is a bit pricey but you do get a lot of food!  Try the fried musubi!
Love this spot! Gets a bit busy during lunch, but definitely worth the wait. I recommend the garlic chicken , deep fried spam musubi, and any of their bentos.

I usually come here and get good food. The other night I got loco moco and I'm pretty sure I got food poisoning from it. I felt terrible that night. I was suffering from night sweats, nausea and woke up the next day and suffered all day. Too bad.. I won't be going any more.

The staff is sweet and the food is great. I tried the chicken katsu and the sauce is sweet and the chicken is very crunchy. It's clean and reasonably priced. This was my first time having Hawaiian food and I will be coming back.

Portions are less and the prices are substantially more. :( 

Love the food and the atmosphere but with the rising costs, my visits become less frequent.

This place is the real deal.  My go to is the kalbi n garlic or furukaki chicken.  Kalbi is always tender and thick. Not like the 1/2 oz ones from aloha kitchen.  It also has nice flavor.  The chickens are basically just covered in different sauces or seasonings.  They all taste good.  I just ask for little more sauce on top.  I also had the Portuguese fried rice which I didn't really care for. Just stick to the mix plates and you can't go wrong.
The food and service were excellent. Everyone was attentive and friendly and the garlic chicken was amazing! Definitely try it!
Food was good not great. We got the Chicken Katsu, and Kalibi. Service was horrible. Cashier was not friendly at all. So much for the Aloha spirit. Choose I another venue if you care about service.

Whoa!  Three words. Miso. Garlic. Chicken.

I have only been here twice because unfortunately it's way on the other side of town for me as I reside in the Southwest area of Vegas.  But after the first time I tried their Miso Garlic Chicken, I drove my a** back there to get it again.  Yes!  It's that good.  I've also tried their Ahi Tuna, Musubi, and their Siamin soup; all are really good too.

This place is a definite must try if you're in the neighborhood.  It's not your normal L&L BBQ joint that sells Hawaiian food; the quality here stands way taller!  Customer service goes beyond limits as well!  Super nice!  I'll be back for sure; and yes, the drive is worth it!

"You look like you went to heaven and back"

That was how my dad described my facial expression as I took a bite out of their garlic chicken. I spent the past two years thinking Island Grill (Eastern & Serene) made the best garlic chicken in town. I was proven wrong when I visited 808 Hawaii Mixed Plate this past weekend. 

We got there around 6pm on a Friday and were the only customer there. High ceiling, spacious, clean. From the place you order, you can see the kitchen which I thought was interesting. 

After looking through the pictures on yelp, I knew I had to try their garlic chicken. I believe there are two sizes, mini and original. You can choose either the tossed green salad or macaroni salad. Our food came out within 10 minutes! For $8-$9 a plate, the portion was huge. It came with 7-10 pieces of garlic chicken, two scoops of rice and the tossed green salad (Original size). 

Garlic chicken is very different from the one served at Island Grill. First of all, it comes with miso mayo. It was very subtle in flavor but very creamy. Second of all, garlic chicken itself is flavorful, tender and juicy unlike the garlic chicken at island grill which are crispy but can be dry at times. This amazing miso mayo, combined with juicy chicken=ONOLICIOUS!

Needless to say, I am coming back again very soon. Mahalo, 808 Hawaii Mixed Plate.

Eat at L&L?  You should think about eating here at 808 Hawaii Mixed Plate instead.  Nothing against the Mickey D's of the plate lunch crowd, but at least 808 is owned by some legit Hawaii folks, not franchised.  Yes, the Chinese owners of your local L&L CAN change your Hawaiian food and make it taste different.

Came here one night for dinner.  Lots of Hawaii locals, so you know it just may be a place to go for some ono eats.  Yelp, why did you just red underline the word ONO for me?  You would have figured by now your review section knows it means yummy!

Was near closing, and there was still a nice little line.  Luckily, what I came for they still had.  Other reviewers rave about the garlic chicken, and they weren't wrong.  This buggah was good!  Ordered a regular plate of this and wasn't sorry.  Pan fried, marinated chicken thighs, topped with miso-mayo sauce...BOMB!  And when you say garlic, it means GARLIC.  Flavored all the way through with that stinking rose!  So if you don't like garlic, either stay away, or order an extra scoop of rice or macaroni salad to balance out the kick.  Good for me that I love garlic.  Very good dish.

The wifey ended up with a $6 bento with fried saimin, Spam, teriyaki chicken, and a scoop of rice.  Tiny portion if you ask me, but it was enough for her.  The fried saimin had good flavor, and a hint of sweetness.  Put some cracked black pepper on top and you're ready to go.  She enjoyed it overall.

Menu at 808 Hawaii Mixed Plate is very similar to other Hawaiian joints like L&L and Aloha Kitchen.  Basics like teriyaki beef, chicken katsu, kalbi, and sesame chicken all on the list.  Specials can change daily but are plentiful and often varied.  I've seen:

-Pan roasted mahi mahi
-Misoyaki butterfish (like you find at Roy's)
-Oxtail soup (I must try)

Prices are reasonable, and will probably set you back around the $20-$25 dollar range for two people depending on what you order.  You get just enough food to fill your tummy.  But I wish the portions were a bit larger.  If you look on their Facebook page you should be able to order from 808 online with little hassle.  Or just call their phone number and place it that way.  They also do catering for your next party or keiki's 1st luau!  

Service was good, as one of the owners came around after our meal to ask us how everything was tasting.  It was after their closing time of 9:00 PM, but she told us no worries, and to take our time to 'talk story'.  Much mahalos for the love aunty, we will be back!

Omg, hands down one of the best Hawaiian food restaurants I have been to. So good! Located on the north side of Las Vegas on Craig. They have a lot of different plates available to choose from, and the serving size is huge. I had leftovers for lunch the next day. I went with the garlic chicken plate and my  bf went with the teriyaki beef plate, both priced about $11. There are also bowls available if you would like a smaller serving size! They also have seafood options available. They cook your food as you order it so I recommend calling ahead to have it ready for you, even on a random Wednesday evening at 5 it was pretty busy

This place had good food. Not like it was "great wow" food but it was okay. The teriyaki beef was standard thin beef with a bottled sauce over it. It was tasty but not memorable. The spam was of course spam so no disappoint there. And the chicken was moist and descent, but could of had more flavor.
Last thing, I'm always weary of places that have more than one soda flavor out....especially when the "Out" signs on them are or look older than two days.
C'mon pay your soda vendor!

Overall experience.... There was nothing standoutish about 808 but it was decent food for my plate!

They have gotten better.  It's been two years since my last review.  We ordered a bunch of food recently.  The seared ahi was awesome.  The Kahlua pig and cabbage was tasty, but for $10 the portion seems a bit small to me.  The Kalbi Shortribs were some of the best I have ever had.  Well done.  Fast friendly service.  My only criticism:  I'm not a fan of market priced items.  There are just too many items with no prices on the menu for me.  I will eat here again though.

Garlic Ahi!!

Yes, their Garlic Ahi is the main reason I come here.  So good that I sometimes get two orders for myself.  The mini's portions are a bit small, so get the regular order if you decide on their Garlic Ahi.  

I've also tried their Spam Masubi, Katsu, and Loco Moco. You can't go wrong with their Katsu and Loco Moco.  Portions are huge.  Cheeseburger in PH probably has a bigger Loco Moco, but 808 is pretty close.  Must be at least a pound of ground beef in their Loco Moco's.  

Service here is always great.  I noticed that everyone is greeted on the way in, on the way out, and even sometimes while you're eating.  Prices are just about the same with everyone else, but remember you get the larger portions here.  One thing I noticed is that food takes a little longer to cook here.  Add a couple of people in front of you and your order can feel like an eternity to come out.  Food is still worth the additional 10 minutes here and I definitely recommend.  

If you're in the mood for Hawaiian, you can't go wrong here.  

Only Issues:
-No brown rice.
-Not open on Monday:  Not their fault, but I tend to crave for Hawaiian on Monday's.  Now I know and knowing is half the battle.

This place is Ono! Coco puffs are amazing! They have all the food from Hawaii. It's a little far from the strip but definitely worth the trip. Had the garlic chicken, Kalbi mix place with the furikake ahi. The owners are super nice and they will make your visit unforgettable.

This maintains itself as being a great restaurant.  When it is in a shopping area that has nothing spectacular in it, and still has a full house, you know they do something right.

I had the garlic chicken and the kalua pork.  Very delicious.  Balance of flavors.  One of the better pork dishes on the go.  

They FINALLY got rid of the screen with the office in the front corner.  Thank you guys for opening up the place 

I hope this place stays around a bit.

SOOO ONOO!!!!! I lived in Pupukea and used to go down makai side and eat Poke every other day. Since we moved back to mainland I have been DYING for Hawaiian grindz. We stopped here on our way through to California and are so glad we did. Not only are they priced super cheap (which means you can load up on more! Haha!! ) the food is onolicious. Seriously. The spicy poke was just how I remembered it. The ahi frukake is killah. Know we had to stock up on musubis for the rest of our trip.  

The tables were messy and full of dishes when we got there. But it's just because the foods so damn good and they always busy! Stay open minded the foods got soul.
Solid dishes and clean facility, they just take too long to serve the food. A bit high priced yet acceptable.
That Mahi mahi burger is good. But sometimes they don't have it and that sucks. If they had it all the time I'd give them 5 stars. The chicken is really good though firecracker and garlic both !!!!!

Hubby and I moved to North Las vegas a few months ago and the one thing we really miss are all the great restaurants in the southwest side of town.  So, we were definitely glad that we found an authentic Hawaiian "plate lunch" type restaurant ! :)  
I love their garlic chicken with garlic miso, my husband love their beef stew ! 
Tip: Look for the daily specials posted on the side :)

Fried Noodles topped with Garlic Chicken - Yummers!!!!!
Just wish they had chicken breast - (way more healthier than chicken thigh)
My nephew got the Loco Moco and even though I never order that dish , it looked yummy as well.
We also tried a piece of their Mango Cream Cake = it was light and creamy
Cream Puffs - I like that this wasn't overly sweet either
Both desserts had the right amount of sweet but sadly they aren't always offered......
Gosh, Darn -  this place is not at all near where I live and I am just about never in this area but if I am, I know where I'm eating....

Best hawaiian/local food here in vegas! Drove from   south side just to try it out and it was worth the drive! I had the lau lau and kalua pig plate. Lomi lomi salmon was soooo good! Perfect for me. The garlic chicken with miso sauce was so bomb! Especially the garlic seared ahi, best fish I've had! I'm gonna finish this review off with saying the mac salad is hands down the best in vegas! It tastes just like my all time favorite (back at home in hawaii) from Zippy's. I will be coming here whenever I feel homesick. And I just moved here

I have been wanting to try this place for a Very Long Time, Now that I live Close by....I Will Be Returning! This is my 2nd time coming here, and I have not been Disappointed. The Owner of this Establishment is Oh So Friendly! It's like I was back in Hawaii! You get that Same Aloha Spirit Coming here! 

The Establishment is located on Craig Road, on the Left where Big Lots, and My Other Favorite Spot (Poke Express) is there as well! Always Clean, Great Customer Service. They did hire a New Counterperson, so Please be Patient with her. The Menu is Above the Ordering Counter. Drinks are located on the Right of the Counter, and the Restrooms are on the left. 

You can either Dine-In, or Take Out! If you Dine in, they Bring the Food to you. Although they Open at 11am (Closed Mondays) They Still Serve Breakfast all day! Woohooo!!! Their Menu Ranges from Hawaiian Delicacies like LauLau, Kalua Pork, Spam Musubis, and the List goes on....I really liked their Fried Saimin, and Furikake Chicken! Those are Da Bomb!

If you don't know what to Order, the girls at the Counter will be More than Happy to Help you! 

This is Most Definitely My Favorite "Local" Spot when I Need My Hawaiian Craving Met! =)

A legit Hawaiian style eatery owned by local people from Hawaii. 

Items tried & liked (so far): 
Garlic Chicken
Firecracker Chicken
Shoyu Chicken
Fried Saimin
Saimin
Won Tun Min
Chili Dog Plate (special of the day) 
Cone Sushi 
Maki Sushi
Chantilly Cake 
Rainbow Cake

Their portions are generous and well worth the price. Just a tip, you get more for your money if you order a regular plate Insted of a mini. 

It has a very homey feel, I felt like I was at my aunties house back in Hawaii :) Staff was welcoming & friendly. Food was fresh and served up quickly. Definitely check them out if you are in the area.

This place is so good, I wish they had a location in green valley. If they were I would be here many times a week. 
I work all over town, and so whenever I am going to be up around the Craig road area I make it a point to stop in. 
I haven't tried the whole menu, but for sure the garlic chicken is worth the trip all on its own. 
The people that work there are so friendly. The food takes some time to make, but the quality of food shows! I can't complain about a single thing. If you get a chance to go here then you definitely need to go.

After being in the mainland for a week, we were sick of eating pizza/tacos/chicken/pasta so we looked for Hawaii food and found it. (Thanks, fellow yelpers!)

Food was more 'ono than home and that's saying a LOT. And they give choke food! CHOKE! And the prices are good. $5 for a mini bento that was huge.

Excellent food!!! Go get em go get em go get em now go!!!

We came here after a movie with our Sons who love this place and I have to admit, it's great.  I had the 808 Combo plate with Garlic Chicken and the Kalbi ribs. Damn good. Wifey had the Combo with the Garlic Chicken and Katsu Chicken. Also great. Clean place with friendly people. Highly recommended.

Walking in, it was apparent that this was authentic island food. They use iPads and square reader to ring transactions. they accept apple pay, but have to enter your tip amount$ first then swipe or insert card. hmm, first time I've seen this.

But the two ladies asked if it was our first time, we mentioned we've been to other hawaiin places down in henderson. Right away, she asked one of the cooks to cook a garlic chicken. I was confused because I had not ordered yet. But this was to make us fresh samples to taste! wow!

she described the miso sauce they use on top of the chicken, which by the way (10/10 would recommend) she mentioned that we can have it on top or on the side, which ever we prefer.

After we got our order (they walked it over to us) they kept checking in on us & asking if we were okay. 
they clean and bus their own tables.

they gave us a to go box for me (portions are fair and large)
ORDER THE GARLIC CHICKEN, soo gooooood!!!

Alohaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa

Wow! This food is delicious! I've eaten at plenty HI places in Vegas & this is by far the best. 

It's a family owned business, & it feels like eating at a friends house.

I had garlic chicken & spare ribs mixed plate. Ahhhmazzing (though pricy $15) it's so worth it if you don't mind spending the extra $4 in comparison to other HI places. Very filling & tasty. I'll be back soon!

Vegas is called the 9th Hawaiian Island for a reason.... and it's because of 808 Hawaii Mixed Plate! Having just come back from a week long vacation in Hawaii, I've been feeling the withdrawal symptoms and have been overdosing on every Hawaiian restaurant in the Valley to make me feel better. After a month of testing out different places, 808 Hawaii Mixed Plate has been my favorite so far. 
The restaurant isn't in the best of neighborhoods, the restaurant isn't the most sparkling clean- but this just gave it a slightly more Hawaiian feel ;) The girl at the counter wasn't the most helpful and their menu was pretty confusing. Don't forget to look down, back, side to side... They seem to have specials and mixed plate signs all over the place. Also they have a happy hour where your order is 15% off? I didn't see a sign, not sure of the time! 
CHICKEN CHICKEN CHICKEN. ORDER THE CHICKEN. The furikake chicken and the katsu chicken plate were the best I've ever had. Both had very thick filets and were soft to the point they melted in your mouth. It really disappoints me when the breading is twice as thick as the piece of chicken itself, but that was not the case here. So much chicken, so much flavor, perfect amount of breading (for the katsu). 
The garlic mahi mahi was okay, but I think the chicken is where they shine. The mac salad was good, but had chunks of potatoes in it which made it not only feel thick, like mac salad usually feels to me, but also heavy. It was good, but hard to take more than a couple of bites! 
I love mom and pop shops and I love seeing owners interacting with customers or even working in booths inside the restaurant rather than in the back. It always gives it a more family- feel. I'll for sure be back!

Excellent ,authentic, good eating food.
Prepared by a terrific jovial happy to serve you staff. 
Truly a delightful and refreshing find .
Very good Hawaiian food, friendly service, clean dining room and fair prices make 808 MHP worthy of a visit if you live in the North side of town.

You've never had a kalbi plate like this! Super thick cut of kalbi beef! Luckily, they slice it up for your so you don't have to struggle with a knife. You can witness the thickness of the kalbi because the bones are still there. Enjoy gnawing on the meat off the bones or give them to your pooch as a nice treat. You can request without the bone too. 

Seems like everyone likes the garlic chicken. Will come back to try that next time we're in Vegas.
Best taste of Hawaii I've had in a long time. Looking for something that's somewhat authentic head here. It is bombDOTcom!

I love their customer service! Their food is amazing. I have used their restaurant.com specials and am extremely satisfied. The owner is a sweet heart and was very attentive. I took my mom here, first time eating Hawaiian and she as well was pleased with both the food and service. Thank you!

Never order from this place through Uber Eats. I ordered my food at the 230pm, and the estimated time of pick up was 3pm. At 330, I called to check on my order, the person on the phone answers the phone, continues on a different conversation,  then tells me to hold. While I'm holding,  I'm listening to her conversation and 3 mins of waiting, she hangs up the phone on me. I wait 10 mins, and she answers the phone to tell me, at 345, that they didn't get my order in, and it will be another 20 mins before they finish.  Absolutely the worst customer service experience I have ever had.

Garlic chicken and Mac salad is delicious ... I didn't care so much for some of the employees one in particular ...and it is a little pricey.  My partner really liked this place and had no complaints. We will go back again someday

Nice service here! Food is delish & staff are friendly. Very laid back with island music playing. Orders are placed at the counter and you serve your own drinks. Food is then brought to your table. I tried the BBQ beef, BBQ chicken, noodles & kalua pork.... yummy!

Chef Brenton never seems to fail at being the person so courteous at all times, let it be just greeting and saying goodbye to us, we always feel that aloha. The food is always Onolicious, like the Kalbi or Garlic chicken or Fried Saimin with Teri Beef on the side. It brings that old saying "Broke Da Mouth!" The Loco Moco needs no explanation but Damn good! Anytime I need the feel of being back home in Hawaii or making an excuse to get to the north side of town, there is no way we can pass up the grinds here. Also if you're in the need for some wicked Poke, it's just a walk down the sidewalk. Mahalos to the gang at 808 Mixed Plate for bringing that perfect and most of the time better than back home mixed plates and specials of the day. Don't stop making the "Mean Kine" desserts too!

All of the chicken dishes I've tried were really good. I liked the Ono Chicken, Garlic Chicken, Furikake Chicken, Sesame Chicken, and the Katsu. I've also tried the roast pork which had a smoky flavor, and kahlua pork which was tasty.

The spam musubi was a little disappointing, there was more rice and less spam than I'm used to. They have some special menu items, but they ran out of it so we couldn't order it.

It's a very casual restaurant.

I love this place even though I've been getting nothing but the chicken plates and only been here twice they seem to always satisfy me. My personal favorites by far is the Ono and Garlic Chicken. If it were my decision, I would rename the Ono Chicken to Oyea Chicken lol. The owners are nice and always recommend a variety of plates to me. They maintain very clean tables and have a 50 inch TV to watch the big games while you grub. Prices are fair compared to the quality of the food you receive. Whenever I'm hungry and in the area I'll be sure to stop by here for more off their menu.

Great for lunch! Good prices for great quality and authentic Hawaiian food. Super chill vibe and great service. 

Had the Kailua pork and cabbage and ahi poke as an 808 mixed plate. Tried firecracker chicken (not spicy at all) and short ribs (delicious sauce!). Very filling and enough food for two meals.

Y'know how when your significant other asks you "where do you want to go eat," and you always say "I don't know..where do you want to go?" Then, it becomes some circular argument for over 15 minutes before you guys settle on something? Now, I finally have an answer to my husband's question!! This is theeeee place to go to when you want a simple lunch!! The lady at the counter was awesome for giving my husband a military discount on his meal without him asking (she noticed my husband's debit card was from a military bank)! Anywho, onto the meal! 

I ordered the garlic chicken with miso mayo per Yelp's suggestions, and OMG it was amazingggggg! The chicken was slightly crispy, garlicky, and sweet from the outside, and chicken meat ohhhhh so soft and tender on the inside! It came with two scoops of rice plus your choice of toss salad or mac salad (8.50), and the boo got the kahlua pork with cabbage! His dish was amazzzziiiing as well (shhh i snatched his leftovers at home)! The kahlua pork complemented the rice so well! The meals here get you comfortably full, with some left over to take home!

They bring out the food to your table if you're dining in, so pleaseeee don't forget to tip them when they ring up your food :)

Yummy, cheap, a thousand times better than Panda Express or any other main-stream place (such as L&L). This is a very non-assuming joint in a big shopping center off of Craig in North Las Vegas, but if you find it, you have found a gem!

I went here on a lunch date with a friend of mine and we arrived just around 11:40 AM on a Friday. There were open booths/tables and a small line. We both took our time checking out the menu and decided to get one of their daily specials, the "808" special. You get two choices of entrees (however it is limited to certain ones), and your choice of slaw, rice, or a mixed green salad. 

My friend and I like to share so we thought this would be the best way for us to try a bunch of different things, so here's what we got:

Chicken Katsu
Shoyu Chicken
Grilled Salmon
Garlic Ahi
Spam Musubi (2)

My favorites were definitely the grilled salmon and the garlic ahi. The chicken was so-so. So I would absolutely reccomened the fish dishes over anything else here. The salmon seriously had this amazing flavoring in it that made it so yummy. My friend doesn't even like salmon and she said she liked this one. The musubi was good too and it had just come out fresh when we ordered ours.

I love that you can get a green salad here as a side. This one they had was great too - leafy greens, very fresh and with a nice side of dressing as well. 

If you live in the NLV area you should definitely make it a habit to come here. I know I'm going to be coming back.
Today was their last day open! THEY ARE NOW CLOSED FOR GOOD :( the girl told me they MIGHT open a new location...

When you want real local island style food, you gotta stop in dis place. If you want poki then you gotta stop in Poki Express and come walk over to 808 for everything else. These two places will remind you of being back home on da islands because they treat you like family and you will think your mom and grandma made everything.
Come chop and you won't ever regret it.

I ordered take out for lunch.  There was a party of 3 already sitting at a table waiting for their lunch.  I ordered a Chicken Katsu plate and a Kalbi plate and paid at the counter and waited almost 20 minutes for my food.
