They offer a military discount since they are fairly close to Nellis Air Force Base in North Las Vegas.

About a dozen Spam Musubi were sitting on the counter.  They were still warm.  I picked up 2 of them.  They were sweet and melt-in-your-mouth goodness.

The Chicken Katsu looked like it had been refried.  It was pretty dark and dried out.  It was served wih a red ketchup-like sauce rather the sweet brown sauce that I am used to with Katsu.

The Kalbi was cut up into small strips which was nice.  It wasn't charred because I asked for it to be grilled medium.  It was a little fatty and over seasoned.  For $12, it was a little pricey.

Both entrees were served on a bed of rice with a scoop of rice and macaroni salad.
I would give them another try.  I just wouldn't order either dish again.  There are so many Hawaiian restaurants to try.
Staff is friendly but the food just doesn't have that quality we are looking for especially for the price.

Tried their chicken katsu, and while the chicken was good, the katsu sauce tasted like salad dressing. Or maybe it was the salad dressing? But whatever the case, you should always have chicken katsu served with katsu sauce and and it definitely should taste like it. Well, maybe I'd go back again; but next time I'll try something else.

It is a sad day for the Hawaiian food scene, today 808 Hawaiian Mixed Plate is closing its door. For eight great years they have given us food from their hearts! Through the good times and the difficult times, they showed their Aloha towards each and every person who came through their door. We'll miss the times we spend together loving your food and sharing memories of Hawaii. We thank you for your Aloha and the love you shared with us. We wish you the best and know that you are in our thoughts always. MISS YOU ALREADY!!!!! Las Vegas will miss you.

Born and raised in Hawaii and have heard good things about 808. Friday night and this is our dinner choice.

It's nestled right in a small mall area right next to a soul food place (Ella Em's) which i have bookmarked to also visit. What a coincidence! 

As we arrived we could tell that it was a little steady, walked in and was able to get a seat right away. The inside and searing reminds me of a place back home called Islanders or L&L.

Looking at the menu there are quite a bit options including spam musubi and some Island favorites like Hamburger Steak, Garlic Chicken, Kalbi, etc....Yum!!!!

Got up to the counter to order and had decided on what we wanted, low and behold they were out of what we wanted..okay so what should we get...
Finally went with Garlic Chicken plate, Kaukau Pack (Fried Saimin, Rice, Spam, Sesame Chicken and Grilled Fish) chicken and fish is able to interchange, Spam Musubi and Hurricane Fries (Furikake and Garlic). Total came out to $33.00 with drink. Still a little pricy. The line grew behind us and everyone was surprised to hear that were out of a lot of menu options. I mean it was 5pm and already out of it. 

Food came out pretty quick, in about 10-15 minutes. My daughter was happy with her musubi and i was fairly happy with my Kaukau Pack except for the fish and the very small scoop of rice. Fries, Garlic Chicken and potato mac was ono!!!

Whenever we find a local spot we always like to give it a try and support, i think we'll be back to give it another shot but maybe for lunch instead to be sure that all menu items are available.

I give this place 3 stars due to the fact that what we wanted twice around wasnt available and the fact that the counter interaction was not positive. Hoping to update this review with more stars added on!!!!

If you're craving for local Hawaiian food, this is the place to go! My favorites would be the Bbq chicken, fried noodles, grilled mahi-mahi, and salmon! I'm from the 808, and this is as close as it gets!!!

Ah another little gem of North Las Vegas! My coworker and I came here for lunch in order to celebrate my work anniversary. We came in at exactly noon and it was packed. All of the tables were full or recently vacated with plates still on the table and about 4 people ahead of us in line. Thankfully the crowd cleared out pretty quickly and we were able to score a table after ordering. 

Now to the good stuff, the food. I ordered the garlic chicken bowl with a side of poke. The bowl was just the right portion size for me and the flavor is amazing. It's sort of like a crispy chicken with a mayo type sauce. The poke was very good too, great flavor and very fresh tasting. 

The service here is awesome too. It seems like it might be family owned and they constantly come around to check how you're doing and offer to bring anything you need. Great service, great food, all around great!
Awesome mixed plate joint, they have great selection and nice laid back atmosphere. We will miss all the good Hawaiian food in LV when we move.

I have eaten here multiple times and this place is by far one of the best Hawaiian spots in town.  Without the pictures to prove it, here is the list of must haves so far:  Kahlua Pork with Cabbage, Kalbi Short Ribs Mid-rare, Garlic Chicken, Firecracker Chicken, Furikake Chicken, and the Deep Fried Musubi.  Don't listen to naysayers, this spot is legit.  Whatchu tink?

6-5-18:  so sad to hear this restaurant has closed down.  I really don't understand because every time we had gone it was busy and the food and service are both excellent.  Very few great Hawaiian places left in town but if you guys hear of one, please let me know.  Now for me it is only Island Flavor in the Southwest.  Bummer!

Before I went to the planetarium at CSN Cheyenne, I looked for a place to grub with my family. We're from the Southwest area, so we know & love Island Flavor. With the prices being a little more on the high side, I expected bigger portions & more flavor. We ordered 3 spam musubis, ono chicken bowl, katsu chicken bowl & garlic chicken bowl. The ono & garlic tasted the same, except the ono had some sort of sweet mayo sauce & sesame seeds; I liked the ono best. The spam musubis were average. The inside was kinda dirty. The table next to us had plates, bowls, napkins & drinks on it. There were 2 workers just standing around & didn't bother to clean it up. The drink station is a fountain with iced tea, hi-c fruit punch, coke & sprite. But the area where the straws are was dirty. Stains of spilled drinks, open sugar packets & straw wrappers were everywhere. No napkins to be seen. Most likely won't be coming back.

Been here twice now and have not been let down.  My friends and I made sure to order different things and share to get the most for our money.  I like the daily specials the most, I had the garlic chicken w/miso mayonnaise and the seared furikaki ahi and both were as we say back in Hawaii "broke da mouth".  The location is inconvenient but worth the drive.  YUMMY!!!!

Yeeeeesssss!

I found this place on accident.  I was looking for a poke place in the area, but it was closed.  Luckily, I saw this gem from Craig Road, and decided to give it a try - made safer by noticing their great Yelp reviews.

I'm not super familiar with Hawaiian food, so it took me a long time to decide.  The friendly clerk let me take my time and politely answered my questions.  I ordered a breaded chicken dish with seaweed (see, I don't remember what it was called! maybe the katsu?) at the recommendation of the clerk after giving her an idea of what I like to eat.  After I ordered and paid, I noticed a sign for a daily special - a poke bowl!  I almost switched my order, since that's what I was originally after, but I decided to try something new.  My friend ordered the poke bowl, though, so I got to try it anyway. 

I was glad that I got my dish.  It was delicious.  The sweetness of the chicken balanced with the salty seaweed shreds and the perfectly cooked rice was amazing.  I also very much enjoyed stealing bites from my friend's poke bowl.  

Prices were very reasonable.  Portions were large - I had to take some of mine to go.

Good stuff!  I'll be back!

For starters, it's probably my fault because I only ordered spam musubi, but for something so simple I didn't think it would be so disappointing. My boyfriend and I are both sick so I figured I would just go get something small and simple to take home. I live right between this restaurant and the one on Craig/Decatur but chose this one today because of the higher star rating on Yelp. My first impression was good, there was more people dining in than I've ever seen at the other place which is always a good sign. I ordered 4 spam musubis to-go and my total was 1 dollar more than it should have been. Their prices on the menu board are outdated, which I hadn't realized. Then 20 seconds after I paid she hands me my order! She must have known what I was thinking because she answered my question before it was asked. They are pre-made. Disappointment. Oh well its a simple side food, I went on my way. Once I got home I realized these are the thinnest spam slices I've ever seen on a musubi! And there was more rice than normal too. It had no flavor, barely even tasted like spam. I'll probably be sticking to the other Hawaiian restaurant for my musubi needs since they charge less and give more meat. Plus their sauce has flavor. 

Overall, I might return to try some of their other menu items, but definitely not for my spam musubi cravings. 

At least the lady was nice.
You just can't go wrong with anything on their menu. I normally get the garlic chicken, kalbi or the kalua pork. Sooooo good!
Food always prepared fresh & the portions are amazing! A place to hit up if you're craving some hawaiian food! Great customer service too! Thanks Auntie! Lol
Garlic chicken every time! Try extra miso mayo for more flavor. The only downside is that they do not offer a grilled version.

The people working there were super nice! The food was AMAZING and such a great price! I got an order of spam musibi and the spicy poke with sushi rice, absolutely to die for. Kind of a small place and was full. Would highly recommend this place to friends and family. Their entire menu looks delicious. I was so stuffed from the poke I struggled to finish my musibi!

Great food and service. One of the girls even gave my son a quarter for the little toy machine. I love their spam musubi! My son loves the food, my husband loves the food and we have been here twice now:)

Not many reasons to come to North Vegas but 808 Mix Plate makes it worth it. Authentic Polynesian food made by Polynesian people!

There's really not a bad choice on the menu and so far everything has tasted delicious. Garlic chicken is my favorite and the macaroni salad is top notch Hawaiian Macaroni style. I always top it off with at least 1 spam musubi too!

By far one of the best Hawaiian eateries in Las Vegas. The staff is so inviting and you never feel like your just a customer. I love their Garlic Mismo Chicken which is wonderfully put together. Their mac salad has become one of my weaknesses..Awesome food!!!Nothing on the menu has disappointed me

I moved from Chicago just over a year ago.  I do miss the food in Chicago, BUT at least I can explore and find the hidden gems in LV.  I MUST admit, 808 is a hidden/new found treasure for me!  I have tried several Hawaiian restaurants BUT so far HANDS down, 808 is the best!!!  A few days ago was my 1st time checking this spot out.  My son and I decided on the Katsu chicken and garlic chicken.  It was the BOMB.COM!!!  Even the macaroni salad was delicious, as well as, the brown gravy over the rice .... whhaaaatt!!! This place is so good to me, I called later that day and asked if they cater because I am throwing a home warming and 808 dishes will definitely be included in my menu!! ;^)  Thanks 808!!

I love this place their Kalbi beef is seriously the best it is cooked perfectly and not overly fatty so you get a lot for your money. The service is great here also always very friendly and fast. Their musubi is also good they do it deep fried or regular. Recently I tried the firecracker chicken and it was delicious with a little bit of spice their garlic chicken is also very good and flavorful. The BBQ chicken is also very good, pretty much everything we have tried has been worth it.

A definite 5 Star.  We were only in Vegas for 3 days and we ate here twice. Service was friendly and fast.  The food was excellent.  In the two visits, we ordered the Spicy Ahi Poke Rice Bowl, Breakfast Plate with portuguese sauges, Mix Plate with Grilled Garlic Mahi-Mahi and Garlic Chicken, Kimchi Fried Rice and Spam Musubi.  What made us come back was the Spicy Ahi Poke Rice Bowl and the Mix Plate.  Reasonably price and excellent taste. 

Parking is not a problem.  It's in a shopping center.

A 'must-try' if you haven't gone here.

Super yummy! I'm so glad this place is close to my house. I only wish they brought back the cakes ... I got excited to see it on the menu online but they said they stopped doing cakes for a while. Bummer! Please bring back cakes; dobash, chantilly, coconut, guava & RAINBOW the best cake ever!

Came to this place on the whim. I was playing in a basketball tournament and the gym was about 5 minutes away. I had 3 hours in between games so rather than driving all the way back to the strip, we decided to stay close for lunch and boy am i glad we found this place.

Ordered:
-Mixed plate (Garlic Chicken / Kalbi): Both were delicious! That garlic chicken is pretty decadant and flavorful while still being crispy like katsu. The kalbi was cooked med rare perfectly and was so tender and tasty. Love that they put furikake on the rice, feels like home :)
-Fried Spam Musubi: So crunchy! They use panko bread crumbs and fry it so well! My first time ever having it fried, and it definitely wont be my last!
-Hurricane fries: you can skip this one. its just fries with furikake. Nothing special for the price. 
-Katsu bowl: fried perfectly. a solid option.

The service is great here. A little family-run hole in the wall kind of place, but one you can't miss out on!
The best Hawaiian food in Vegas. Their garlic chicken mixed plate is delicious. Their macaroni potato salad is very home made.

This place has more hype on yelp nowadays. When I first came here it was less "known" Somethings you just don't want to keep a secret. The food is still great and the menu is still cheep. They do seem to run out of certain things on the menu, they always have something good. What more could you ask for. 

The garlic chicken is crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. The wasabi sauce for the fish is dynamite.
Hawaiian style beef stew just like back home:) I shall return for the Filipino Superman's pastele stew and gandule rice! Keep serving up broke da mouth onolicious Local grinds my bruddah
Good place to eat love there first time sample food was good I let them choose my plate well pick will be going there

This place was just okay. I got several mixed plates for the family, so we got to try a little of everything. The nice thing is that you can get half and half of the meats on each plate, so if you can't decide between kalbi and garlic chicken, you can get both. The garlic chicken and chicken katsu weren't anything special. The garlic chicken was smothered in some sweet sauce. It was good but not garlicky. The kalbi was a little disappointing. The meat was kind of dry, seasoning was sweet. The roasted pork in mushroom sauce was pretty good. It wasn't quite what I expected since the pork seemed almost like it was stewed with the sauce. This place wasn't bad, but the photos look a lot better than the actual food.

definatly worth it! massive portions. One of the best Hawaiian places I've had in a long time the food is always top notch the staff is friendly and the place is very clean 5 stars all across the board!

+ Food is awesome!
+ Service is awesome!
- Nothing! 
Go get some Hawaiian Food and make your belly happy.

Love love love his place!  The korean chicken, spam musubi, katsu chicken, bbq beef, fried samion, and garlic chicken are all really good. Haven't had the kalbi ribs yet bcause it takes alittle longer for them to cook and I'm usually getting it to go but I hear they are real good.  The people that work here are super nice too.  First hawaiian food resturant I've eaten at and I'm hooked!

So I've come here about 4 times, each time it was closed. Today I finally got here early enough. Family owned, and very clean. 

   Now to the food. My hubby got the grilled salmon, boy was it fresh. Absolutely delish!  
I got the garlic chicken . It was a heaping helping,  and and was the best I've had.

  Oh yes I'll be back.

Decided to try something new and this place had great reviews. We ordered dine in, it seemed liked they were training. We ordered garlic chicken hurricane fries & mixed platter with Kalbi ribs and some chicken ( wanted firecracker chicken but they were out of it but was told there substitute would be the same). Advised both clerks my wife has a mushroom allergy but was told none of the food has mushrooms (my wife now has hives probably from cross contamination because the clerks refused to tell the back of the house of the allergy).Decided to tip because I work in the industry. After waiting 25 minutes the cashier asks us if we order to go or for here even though the receipt says dine in just like the ones on their board. After a total of 35 minutes we got our food( they brought a fork and knife to me but nothing for my wife's entree, I had to ask) which was cold, the only thing that was hot was the basic white rice. The chicken substitute was not the same although I've never had firecracker chicken ( I asked if it would be spicy and they said yes, it was not) the flavors were good, also the hurricane fries we delicious. Just wish the food was hot. Decided to ask for a box instead of throwing away food, while waiting in line for a box I watch a hot plate of food sit in the window for 3 minutes before served and chef never rang the bell next to it. Chefs are always adamant about food getting hot to a guest but he could care less as he looked at 4 times without a care in the world. Food has good potential but needs some better management and the chef should take more pride in his food. FOOD SHOULD NEVER EVER SIT IN A WINDOW. THAT IS YOUR MASTERPIECE, DISPLAY IT PROUDLY!
Suggestions: Make your rice stand out, add chicken stock, butter, seasoning, something to stand out.
Working more than one position is very difficult (I know from expierence) if they can't run food, chefs or cooks should, your restaurant is not that big it takes a minute or 2 and you had a total of 3 employees in the back so it wasn't backing up. Plus guest love meeting the chef who prepared their amazing meal.
If your gonna run a gourmet type fast food make a station for to go boxes ( I know they cost money), it easier then waiting in line for a box. Also if your gonna bring entrees make sure you bring silverware for each entree. That's the worst of the whole expierence that we order 2 entrees and she brought us 1 set-up that's common sense and the fact that I had to ask you expect my wife to eat her garlic chicken with her hands come on now. Get it together.

Amazing we had an opportunity to order from here for our working place and the food was delicious! they gave a lot of food and even though they are closed on Monday, they did make those accommodations which I think the customer service on that aspect was amazing as well!

We ordered  kalua pig, macaroni salad, chicken katsu and musubi and of course rice.
The macaroni  is made with potatoes too, which is different but I actually enjoyed it.

Now usually take about my chicken katsu be as if the sauce is me too sweet this sauce  was good.. It's not your normal katsu sauce...its tangy-sweet....

The reason for the 4 stars is because they  are way up on Craig Road..they need to be right around the corner from me LOL!

Also they gave a lot for a great price we will be ordering from them again!

How can I not rate this as a five star choice? 

Staff- Amazing and family owned  CHECK!
Food- Delish beyond belief   CHECK!
Setting - Clean and uncluttered  CHECK!

I ordered the bbq beef mini plate. This beef was so awesome that I stuffed myself more than I wanted to for lunch. I didn't eat the rest of the day. I wanted to run around the restaurant wearing the bbq beef on my face like that Buffalo Bill guy from Silence of the Lambs who was making the flesh suit. "Put the lotion in the basket!!!". Yeah, him. It was THAT good.

Garlic chicken had a nice glaze and sauce.  It wasn't too garlicy and had good flavor. The rice in the cone sushi wasn't as sticky as I would have expected but it had good flavor.  My friends loved the saimin!  All in this place has really good eats!

I would have given this place 5 starts because the ONE time I've been here it was amazing. Other than that I have been back about 7 or 8 times and it's always CLOSED. I understand it's family operated but it seems like this family goes on personal trips every month. Wish they would stay true to their posted hours.

Very polite, they asked if it was my first time,  have me samples to try. Good was very good, really flavorful. Had garlic chicken,  and portion and cabage. Really healthy too.
 They deserve a bigger restaurant, that would make them perfect.
This is my new favorite spot for Hawaiian food! The poke is the bomb! Kalbie is good! I'm working my way to the burgers.

I love this place.   You have to try the garlic chicken with miso mayo.  Had a dessert called poi mochi.  If you like mochi you will love this.   Not very sweet and really chewy.   Everytime I have come here the service is great and all of the workers are very friendly.

Wow, talk about the Aloha spirit. Traveling through on business. First time in LV and haven't had Local food in almost 3 years due to our family being stationed in Europe. Driving to Nellis AFB and happened on this gem of a restaurant. Let me tell you the food was awesome and the Aloha spirit was truly exceptional. Although I haven't been able to go home to Hawaii in a while, I truly felt the spirit of Aloha through the food and hospitality of the locals that own and work in this wonderful establishment. 

Mahalo 808 for making my first time in LV a tasteful one. BTW the poi, garlic chicken, and kalbi was AWESOME!!!!! See you guys again when I pass through LV.

I ordered the firecracker chicken and hurricane fries. The chicken was excellent. It tasted great and was the perfect portion. The fries were a drawback, the amount of seaweed that they use just overpowers it all. Menu items were decently priced and the service was great. I'll be heading back for more chicken.

I got the garlic chicken plate that comes with 2 scoops of white rice and macaroni salad. The chicken was packed with flavor and I love the sauce that was drizzled on top. I would recommend calling in during lunch or ordering online to get your food faster. Solid hawaiian food, wayyyy better than L&L!

The food I just had was great the BBQ chicken with white rice and Mac Salad is absolutely amazing. On Fridays they also have a special menu offering the Kalu Pig I will be getting that next time. Loved the staff so nice thank you.

BF and I wanted a Hawaiian day and got poke at Poke Express and then grabbed a lunch plate to share. 

We got the 808 Special Mix Plate where you get to pick two meats, rice and mac for $9.50. We picked sesame chicken and shoyu chicken. 

It's not as fast as other mixed plate places. That I suppose is can be a good thing since it's freshly cooked. We had some poke to nosh on from Poke Express anyways while we waited. 

We bit into the sesame chicken and I thought it was supposed to have sauce so we asked if we can have some sauce. They said they were out of the sesame sauce...er, okay, thanks for letting us know when we got our order. I never had sesame chicken so I don't quite know now what it's really supposed to taste like. We asked for some katsu sauce then since it just needed something to dip the fried chicken in. Their katsu sauce is more tangy, almost ketchup-y compared to other places I've gone to. The shoyu chicken is 2  bone in thigh and it reminds me of Filipino adobo, but sweeter since it stews in the shoyu. The mac is interesting in that it has potato, and tuna in it...it's pretty good to me, but for some people who like plain mac might not be into it. 

Overall the place was an okay place to get plate lunch. I'm very curious how their lau lau and kalua pork stack up. Til next time- 3.5 stars.

This is our go-to spot when we're wanting Hawaiian food in LV. This place is the BEST for getting authentic Hawaiian dishes. My boyfriend is from Hawaii and we go back frequently. This place reminds us of one of the local spots in Hawaii and that says something. Everyone is extremely friendly and gives the Hawaiian hospitality every time you walk through the door. Every dish on the menu is delicious and flavorful. You can't go wrong with any of them. We've never had a bad dish or experience. My favorite is the garlic chicken plate with mac salad and my boyfriend loves getting the Garlic bento. I definitely recommend coming here if you want great Hawaiian food & customer service.
Great food and service. They were very accommodating to allow our big group to reserve the entire eating area for lunch in advance.

Love love love! I'm a super boring, picky eater with random bouts of exotic tastes. This is a favorite go to on Sundays and when new people come to town lol. Love the garlic chicken-the sauce is addictive!  Kids beg for it weekly:)

Yet another establishment I might not have tried if I hadn't found their awesome rating on Yelp...even though I frequented Teriyaki Madness a few suites over plenty for a while.

808 Hawaii Mixed Plate has some of the greatest Hawaiian BBQ dishes I've had. If the wait time wasn't so long, I would have easily given them a 5 stars. However, every time I've gone, it's been about a 45 minute wait from getting in line to order to getting the food. Usually I'd be a little ticked off by this, but once I take a bite of the food that's a little bit of heaven, it's nearly erased from my mind.

The garlic chicken...I can't even begin to describe it. It's so delicious; seasoned well and accompanied by such a unique and tasty sauce. The short ribs are pretty good as well. Also, the macaroni salad is different than most Hawaiian BBQ places I've had. In my opinion, it's better. Not bland or too creamy. 

I totally recommend trying this place out. If you can, call first! Sadly, I haven't been able to find their menu online anywhere. Doesn't mean you can't ask them. The girl working behind the counter has always been super nice.
Needed food for a volleyball tournament. Chicken katsu was good and the beef plate was great. Very soft and tender. Would recommend this place.

Was not good at all. The beef that I got was full of fatty pieces that were uneatable. I was disappointed in the Mac salad as it had way too many potatoes in it, should of been called potato salad. I left hungry and had to pick up food on the way home.

I come here often ,because of the flavor and its different from other Hawaiian restaurants.Well looks and tastes like some things have changed , added more itesms to their menu , but also changed the way some of the menu items are cooked ,  I this time ordered the 808 pack because I want the combination of beef and chicken.  I noticed that the beef was cooked like any other Hawaiian restaurant where before the beef used to be cooked over a grill and have grill flavor taste.... Not this time ,I wont be back here for a while. ..

Great Kalbi Short Ribs here!

These were super thick cuts...steak like! 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/808-hawaii-mixed-plate-north-las-vegas?select=Om0WsPU8yTKLX35G-3nUxw

Cooked perfectly to order, with lots of flavor and juices! Very fatty though, but just eat around it to get all that goodness. These took a solid 20min to prepare and cook to a great medium rare, but it was worth the wait.  A little spendy at a solid $15, but it is more like a steak than your average kalbi order.

I tried some of the Garlic Ahi, and it was amazing!  Very tender, sushi grade ahi, but with a gorgeous sauce covering it.  Packed with flavor...it was very very good...and I plan to order it next time I am here!

Musubi had too much rice though.  It was like a double decker...with twice the rice needed for an enjoyable musubi.

Gotta be one of the best Hawaiian spots in town :)

I'll be back!
This place was pretty good for hawaiian BBQ. The people who work there/own the restaurant are very friendly.

Miso garlic chicken FTW. So good you have to try it yourself.

Don't get the kahlua pork...if you open that dish next to the miso garlic chicken, it pales in comparison. Literally!  I bought those 2 dishes for me and a friend (me-garlic, friend-pork).  My friend was so sad that their dish looked WAY less tasty. The pork was bland and not too appetizing.

Loco Moco here isn't bad...although I think Baby Stacks has a better one--their dark brown gravy sauce is money.

Decent/average prices. 

Line can be slow sometimes, esp during peak times. They have a slow credit card machine.

Moving from Hawaii my husband and I finally started missing home and it's amazing food. We went to another Hawaiian food place and the food was a 3/10 at best with some not so nice servers. When we came here it was really busy but the staff was friendly and handled the line well (guess they're always busy and I can see why) not only was the food delicious the portion sizes were amazing for their prices. And it also tastes exactly like home from the Kalua pork to the chicken Katsu all the way down to the macaroni salad! Definitely will be coming back for more
Best Hawaiin food in town hands down!  Took friends and family here, and no one leaves disappointed.  Their Ono chicken is the best you'll get away from the islands.
FYI- now they are closed on Sundays and open on Mondays. Still bomb.

Items Selected:
Korean Wings - Hot Style
Fried Saimin
Mixed Plate with Kalua Pork & Cabbage, Ono Chicken, Steamed Rice and Mac
Deep Fried Musubi with Unagi Sauce and Spicy Mayo
Blueberry Butter Mochi
Ube Butter Mochi

Hailing from the Midwest it would be an understatement to say that Hawaiian food was locally underrepresented, and even to this day a search of restaurants close to Northwest Ohio indicates zero serving anything 'Hawaiian' save for the "Flaming Hawaiian Volcano Roll" at a particularly sad looking Sushi joint, thus when a patient from the Big Island suggested that the most authentic taste of home she'd found since living in Las Vegas was at 808 Hawaii Mixed Plate on West Craig Road the decision was made to stop in, though a drive of nearly thirty minutes from home made such a thing somewhat laborious.

In reality located in North Las Vegas, a completely different entity from Las Vegas proper to those unfamiliar, and operated by the same family for seven years in a shopping plaza next to Ella Em's Soul Food, 808 Hawaii Mixed Plate is presented as a counter-service concept in which diners are invited to approach a menu hanging at the far end of a lengthy space over a wide window looking into the kitchen, the owner's wife serving as the sole front-of-house staff-member as she pulls triple duty as cashier, server and story-teller, an early arrival before the crowds allowing for plenty of the latter.

Truly a wealth of knowledge as relates to her homeland's history, the 'plantation era' briefly described when explaining Saimin Noodles to the uninitiated, it was with several questions asked and answered that decisions were made from a board that at first seems brief before one really digs into the various offerings for Meats and toppings, the decision to try one mixed plate plus Noodles, an Appetizer, two sweets and a side easily enough food for four, all at the total cost of just under thirty dollars.

Taking a seat in the minimally decorated space, The Food Network displayed  on televisions as diners are left to peruse a flip-card indicating daily specials plus a Brunch menu offered on Sundays, it was after perhaps five minutes that plates one and two were delivered from the kitchen, the aforementioned Egg Noodles pan fried in a slick sauce with Ham and a mix of Cabbage, Radishes and Green Onions, the flavor largely that of light Sesame plus a bit of Ginger while the half-dozen Chicken Wings were twice-fried crisp and medium-hot, the meat on the inside plump with a good seasoning of its own and tender but not greasy.

Offering Chicken in no less than ten styles, a sample of the Garlic version topped in yellow Aioli a bit too pungent while the "Ono Chicken" takes the Katsu-style Thigh meat and lightly tosses it in a pan of Garlic, Onions and Oil with outstanding results, the $11.50 "Mixed Plate" was completed with a small bowl of shredded Pork and Cabbage next to two big mounds of Rice and a rather flavorless Macaroni Salad, the deep-fried Musubi marrying Hawaii's love of Spam with Spicy Mayonnaise, Unagi Sauce and Furikake in an unexpectedly compelling manner that could change the opinion of many mainlanders as relates to canned Meat.

Told that 808's Pastry Chef, actually the owner's son, was vacationing back home currently, thus leaving only two types of Butter Mochi available for Dessert, it was with one of each that the meal came to an end, the version topped in Blueberries unfortunately quite disappointing with a gummy texture and not much sweetness while the block of sticky Purple Yam proved somewhat better, though certainly not on par with the pies and cakes featured in Social Media, nor the Macadamia Nut Pancakes or Bread Pudding French Toast offered at Brunch.

***1/2: Thriving as a family run eatery in North Las Vegas for almost eight years thanks to a dedicated following of Hawaiians searching for the real thing, 808 Hawaii Mixed Plate is a worthy destination for those seeking something a little different from the big-box Poke stops springing up across the Valley, the prices a genuine bargain for both the quality and the portion sizes even when accounting for the gallon or so of gas it will take most Las Vegans to get there.

We ordered the fried rice plate with Portuguese sausage and da 808 plate which is a mixed plate which we got furikake chicken and kalbi. So the food was really good. The flavors were different but in a good way. The fried rice was a bit too oyster saucey for me. The furikake chicken was tasty but came in small pieces. Our total was about $30 which is pricey. But like I said it was tasty I'd come back but I'd probably just do a single it plate.

On a wednesday afternoon, lunch break, I had the garlic chicken miso mayo large for 7.78 (10% military discount)

- VA friendly! if you work there, you get the 10% off.
- Safe for a lunch break. It takes 15min just to get there. EAT fast.
- Cute little hawaiian kid opens the door for me and welcomes me in. nice service!
- Timing is everything. ready quick! about 7min. 
- 2 rice scoops, 1 mac salad scoop, and the chicken.
- miso mayo is great! love the flavor. good after taste. KISSS! garlic :)
- HAWAIIAN appettite fail. small portion. no doggie bag? I actually finished ALL my food.
- Overall, great taste and friendly service. The chef actually patted my back and asked if I liked the food..lol. 
- Would be 5 if more chicken. cmon...

This has got to be the best Hawaiian restaurant that I've been to.  The food is very tasty and it's close to home.  It's in the same shopping complex as Poke Express.  Hawaiian goodness in one area!

We got there to place a to-go order.  I'm not sure why I didn't call to place my order but oh well.  The kalbi takes 20 minutes but it was soooo worth the wait.  It was juicy, tender, a bit fatty and the flavor was great.  The Spam musubi was alright - it had a bit too much rice though.  The garlic chicken was also good, lightly breaded but it wasn't as garlicky as I would have liked.  Good thing I also got the GARLIC AHI - it was sooooo good.  The fish was fresh and the flavor was AMAZING.  It was topped with toasted garlic.  Easily, the best item on their menu!  

Their portions are generous.  I wanted to finish my food but it was just too much.  I'll keep coming back for more garlic ahi though.  Yes, it's THAT good!

Family and I ordered the fried noodles, meat jhun, shoyu poke bowl and musubis. Everything tasted really good...the fried noodles reminded me of the kind you get from the manapua truck. Staff was friendly and the sitting area was clean. Only downside is that we live in Henderson and this place is about 35 minutes away. Glad we tried it and we will surely be back.

Awesome food and service!! Thank you Aunty Eunice!!

This was an awesome find through Yelp when I visited Vegas in July. If any locals from Hawaii are craving a good taste from the islands... Here it is! My friend lived here for more than a year and missed Korean fried chicken. She loved the taste of it here. Totally bright her back to the Big Island. 

Really a must try- you walk in and already feel the Aloha!

Real authentic Hawaiian food. Been trying to find one ever since I went to the mainland. 
Best one I have found! 
Really feels like home

I love the Garlic chicken and I have been here many times for it and I asked for an extra sauce for my chicken like I have before and they charged me a full dollar for an extra 2 oz. sauce for the garlic chicken when I have never had to pay that before. I did feel bad for complaining to the worker because she doesn't make the prices. It was ridiculous.

UPDATE:::::

I went in to order today and was approached by the friendliest person!! We were waiting in line, and he came all the way from the back kitchen to speak to me.. He asked if I wrote the review, I told him yes and we just talked about the food and if it wasn't to my liking etc.. I NEVER thought these reviews were even read by anyone until today! It was a good feeling knowing that my review was actually read and taking into accountability.. 

We ordered 4 different plates and they were all superb! The food tasted like how it use too!! I am just so impressed with the customer service, food and the caring of the customers!!! Get to this place for lunch or dinner and I promise you are in for a treat!!

Wow ! Food is extremely delicious . We order take out over the phone at 8:40 PM and they close at 9 and they were very kind enough to take our order . The lady taking our order was very patient with us in which we were still very indecisive. We got there shortly after and the place was completely empty because they were about to close , so it was so nice of them to still accommodate our take out order

We order the garlic bento , 808 mixed plate with kalbi ribs and garlic chicken , a regular misubi and a fried misubi. Man was it delicious . It was way more than enough food for two people and we have have way more than enough left overs for tomorrow.

Additionally , this restaurant is one the few 5 star places that is offered on restaurants.com . So if anybody is like me and is a huge foodie, but loves to save , this is the place to chose. We had the spend 30 , pay $15 voucher off restaurants.com and with everything we ordered, it put us at just about $15.00 . 

What a steal !! 

This place is definitely worth the try . Very friendly staff as well , to say the least. Thanks 808 for the delicious dinner
Great food! They will go over menu items if you have any questions. About 10 tables to sit at. Very clean restaurant, friendly staff but a little pricey for what you get

Absolutely Delicious. I had the mixed plate with Sesame Chicken and Chicken Katsu. Had enough sauce on the Sesame but wasnt over powering. The Katsu came with big pieces with a nice mayo type sauce i never had before. Reasonably priced and i left full. I didnt have the Spam Musubi but it looked fresh. Spam isnt my forte though. The waitress comes around to check on you. And you feel like family when your in there. I will go back there again.

Oh garlic seared ahi, how I love thee. The mini portion is just the right size; one scoop of rice, one scoop of mac or green salad, and some slices of beautifully cooked fish is all I need. ACTUALLY! I need that wasabi butter mixture. I mixed it with the rice, I dipped the fish in there, I fished out all the delicious morsels that fell in, I might have drank it if I did not fear for my waistline. 

I am impressed with places that ask you how you want your protein cooked. No, I am not talking about fine dining or a steak house. I mean everyday places that can be mistaken for fast food. Yes, I do want my ahi cooked to a medium rare. Yes, I do understand that it will be raw in the middle. Yes, I would love to see that the medium rare I ordered was cooked to perfection. Not only was my meal prepared well, but a friend's kalbi was pretty amazing as well.They are thick cuts of tender meat and I LOVE picking at the bones. The marinade was sweet and savory. Just the perfect mix and it had me wishing I ordered my own plate. My only gripe is with the spam musubi. There is just too much rice and a tiny slice of spam. I want more! Once I get past that. I am a happy camper.

Went and had the garlic chicken and it was all right.  I would have preferred it to be more garlicky but it was not bad.  The only thing that turned me off was that the prices are kind of expensive for the amount of food they give you.  They put a small mound of rice under the meat portion to plump it up and make it look like you're getting a lot.  Also personally, it turns me off (from eating) when employees have extremely large gauged ears and tattoos all up their necks and arms.  Call me old school, but it is not what I want to see when dining.

Hawaiian food is fast food...it's meant to be in, boom, and out. I ordered a single Loco Moco and watched 3 whole episodes of Chopped on the wall TV and my food still wasnt ready. On top of that, I looked around at the other 3 people in the restaurant and they too were still waiting.

I went to 808 mix plate 8/25/17 cause I was told it had great reviews so I was very excited . The restaurant has a casual feel which is nice the staff was very friendly which is great make you feel very welcome. But the food was disappointed that I don't know if I came after a rush of something but they were out of the kula pig and cabbage which is  okay I understand so I order the BBQ chicken and the Ona Chicken BBQ was not bad pretty tasty but the ONA Chicken was not good it didn't taste fresh at all it seem like the fried it earlier that day and instead of throwing it away they decided to fried it again and served it . It was so over cooked it was hard it was very disappointing especially how far we came to try something new

Favorite Hawaiian food restaurant in Vegas! Love their Ono chicken, garlic chicken, & deep fried spam musubis. Now they have adobo omlette which we usually drive to Aloha Kitchen for. Excited to try it! Their food is always fresh & flavors are spot on.

Food was decent. Don't believe the hype on the short ribs, but believe I paid $42.00 for two mix plates and 2 spam musubis. Place also had a weird smell and is not very clean. I Wish this place the best in what they do, but I will not consider it if I'm around the area.
The garlic chicken is sooooooo ono!!! Deep fried spam musubi is good too! So much to choose from! I will definitely be going back!

Out running around today and my husband and I decided we wanted a plate lunch.  We always seem to be on Craig road, so sure enough when we spoke of our craving, we both said out loud, 808 mixed plate!  And we headed there right away.

Todays special was the Mahi mahi plate.  It was very good with a sesame drizzle and green onions. Two scoops of rice, and mac salad.  I enjoyed the meal, and the staff were friendly, you can tell they make their food with the aloha spirit.

Back again...it's been a while but anyway--this visit we ordered mini loco Moco and shoyu chicken, and a reg BBQ chicken plate.  Total was $22...we were smart and called in ahead 20 min for our food because if you've dined here before you know how long it takes.  Food was good, still as I remember.  Still 3 stars because service is still hit and miss - plus tonight they ran out of Teri beef, lomi salmon...and no desserts.  Will prob return if ever in the area but def not somewhere I'd make a special trip to.  Suggestion: turn your soda machine around so people can help themselves to their own drinks.  It will allow you more time to service your ordering customers.  Also you should have a permanent dessert menu and put what you offer on a menu....see pics on Facebook but when we go there we don't see any advertisement of desserts.
I love their hula pack with sesame chicken! If I'm on that side of town and they are open I will stop by.

This place is sooooooooo goooooood. The only complaint I have about this place is that they close too early. Otherwise, the food is spectacular, the prices are good for such a large amount of food, and the customer service is excellent. Will miss this place greatly when I move out of the North.
This is handsdown the best Hawaiian food in Las Vegas friendly staff good food,the "ono chicken" highly recommended

This is the best place for the kalbi short ribs in Las Vegas even it is on market price and doesn't open for Monday! 

We ordered raw for short ribs, they have marinated short ribs by themselves, they also have the right thickness for the ribs, so it won't be too dry when it is done grilling. In addition, they gave us some sample for their other famous dish. Omg!! This is a place has the best Hawaiian food and people in Las Vegas.
This place is so good. Never eaten in, but always get take out or Uber eats. I've yet to be disappointed. The fried spam masubi is the best!

I rarely believe any restaurant deserves more than 5 stars, but this hole in the wall place has elevated Hawaiian to a new level and for affordable prices.  Yelp, can we give this place the sixth star?! They do all the classic Hawaiian dishes and they do them well.  What sets this place apart is the creativity of the new dishes that are constantly being created by the chef. He adds a little finesse to your normal Hawaiian dishes, creating innovative masterpieces.  

A little background, the chef hails from Hawaii but worked at a Japanese/French inspired restaurant in LA before coming to Vegas.  He has also spent time in Alan Wong's restaurant in Hawaii being inspired by the pastry chef.  I mean this guy comes with some definite restaurant cred.  This isn't your uncle from the island just whipping up a few home cooked dishes.  He combines his culinary background with inspiration he finds from restaurants all over.

Some of his most recent creations that I've fallen in love with....

1. Firecracker chicken - think chicken fried to a crispy perfection with a hint of sweetness, covered with sriracha mayo sauce.  I swear I have never eaten a dry piece of chicken here.
2.  Ono chicken - another deep fried chicken but with a sweet and spicy Korean sauce and sprinkled with furikake.  I love that sometimes there are just straight up fried pieces of chicken skin mixed in. Don't worry there's enough chicken to feed an army, the skin is just a bonus.
3. Hurricane fries - I will eat myself into obesity with these fries and not even feel bad about it.  I ordered these as part of my pre-wedding meal, that's how serious I am!  Crispy french fries covered in  butter, garlic, parmesan, furikake. Don't tell anyone but sometimes I eat the seasoning by itself that's left at the bottom of the bowl...think crumbs at the bottom of the chip bag scene.
4. Seared furikake ahi with sriracha mayo sauce - grilled just the way you want it!  I get it lightly seared on both sides and this literally melts in my mouth.

These are just some of my favorites available on the menu full time.  The best part is that the menu is ever evolving with new creations: honey mustard chicken, honey butter chicken, salt and pepper ahi, misoyaki butterfish, lemon butter mani mahi, mac nut crunch bars, pumpkin crunch, lilikoi chiffon cake, guava cake...the list is honestly endless.  The chef puts out the specials and gauges the popularity and incorporates the winners into his regular menu.  The best part is going at night, they are a little slower during this time, and he has even more refined dishes on the special dinner menu.  

They also do catering, so definitely something to consider for parties or any other get together.  I love the ohana (family) vibe you get when you walk in.  The aunties always welcome us with a big smile.

I also mentioned to the chef he should do a pop up dinner to show his true culinary prowess....I hope he takes my suggestion seriously ;) Put my name down for the first reservation!
Yes missing Matiki (Cypress, CA) so I thought give this a try. Its good however missed the mark for me. Staff was warm and friendly but hands down if youre in Cali hit up Matiki and say hi to Auntie!

Hands down best Hawaiian restaurant on this side of town. This spot is a part of DreamTrips Local so don't forget to show your DreamTrips app to receive points and a free soda! Everything you order here is delicious and we love the staff!
This is my favorite place to eat at in North Las Vegas. The food is amazing and the staff is great. They know what my wife and I want to order each time. Always a great time.

Not making this long, but I've found coming here in recent times disappointing. It feels like they are sulking in and taking advantage of the fact they are busier. Everything seems so much more expensive, MP (market price) is apparently the new price, and the spirit in there isn't Aloha. While it does depend on staff members...I was always afraid they'd come to this. We'd frequent here when they were just starting out. It felt personable, food quality and price made sense, but now...the inflation of price to value...it's not even worthed anymore. It no longer tastes as good as it used to. Not everyone uderstands that market price deal, so seeing it is easily a turn off. We aren't in a high end restaurant. Even back home in Hawaii you'll get a blunt price especially in terms of kalbi. Seafood MP I get. But kalbi? =/

Our last visit really left a bummed and empty feeling...which is a reminder as to why we no longer frequent here. Safe to say, we will no longer come here...we just cant. But I don't want to take away the fact that they do have tasty items on their menu...just the value is no longer something we feel is worthed.

Small-ish location & busy on Saturday night. We had a party of 6, 4 eating. The kalua pork & cabbage was good. The bowls were good. Mac salad was alright. Spam musubi wasn't quite fried enough for me, but my kids wolfed it down. Hunny ordered the short ribs and got wickedly sick. Would be 3 stars, but the girl at the counter told us they were out of saimin, then served the next family that came in after us 2 bowls of saimin. Kind of disappointing. There's good Hawaiian food in Vegas - we'll keep looking!
Love the late I plates and sauce  and would recommend it to anyone looking for a good food at reasonable price.

This place is a diamond in the rough. Middle of a plaza, small but AMAZING food!! I got their garlic shrimp special (please make it permanent) yumm!!!! Shrimp was not gummy just perfect flavor and their Mac is homemade. Plus they give military discount..  Go see them

I fell in love with some of the traditional Hawaiian plate lunch establishments last year on the Big Island.  Great amounts of food, cooked with love and made with local ingredients, for dirt cheap prices.

So while it is cool that Vegas has tons of plate lunch restaurants, I haven't been happy with any of them.  And this includes the well reviewed ones like Rice Trax, Island Flavor, Ross J's, L & L, and many of the others.  The food is universally very fatty and low quality (to make a lower price point) and for the most part have destroyed my stomach.

But then I tried 808 Hawaii Mixed Plate and I was in heaven and it brought me back to all those great little places on the Big Island.  This place is truely a gem.  Food cooked with love and actual skill, great ingredients, and people that give a shit about what they put in front of you.

Everything I have tried has been excellent.  Pork, chicken, beef, fish, they do it all well.  And they don't think it's weird when I ask to substitute rice - in this case they only have salad.  But what a great salad it is - fresh greens (not iceburg), tomato, cucumber, carrot, and homemade dressing that tastes similar to balsamic but something more complex.  

This gem is definitely worth driving across town for when you're in the mood for a plate lunch.  It will seriously make you wish you were back in Hawaii, and you'll find yourself planning your next vacation there while you're eating.

I ALWAYS got to come here whenever in town. Love their freindly service and the loco moco. I've tried their other dishes but can't seem to get away from deciding on loco moco :P Fair price for the serving you get of food you don't find everywhere. Highly reccomend!

You can never go wrong, come 808 mix plate. 
Garlic chicken is my favorite here. Whenever I want to eat local food this place is the first thing on my mind living on the north side of town. Great food, not fast food remember that! Lol.

When I first moved out to LV, one my staff doctors recommended checking out 808 for lunch. Turns out the docs go here every Friday, it's their weekly ritual. My friends and I decided to check it out for ourselves and we love it. I recommend ordering ahead of time online or by phone, the line can get long here. Here are a few of my favorite dishes:

[1] Deep fried spam musubi - their musubi is legit here, the traditional spam musubi (deep fried of course), topped with sriracha mayo drizzle and furikake... so good. [2] 808 Mixed plate - this is my favorite plate to order, you get rice, two of any lunch plate item, and a side of salad or mac salad. [3] Katsu Chicken - tastes just like Hawaii, crispy panko on the outside, and tender thigh meat on the inside. [4] Garlic Chicken - one of the favorites here at 808, I'm always nervous about having garlic breath and seeing patients, but it's totally worth it! Legit Hawaiian spot and great for lunch in North Vegas.

DAMN - I did thoroughly enjoy my food here!  

I am not sure why but I Love Hawaiian BBQ, even though I have to use spell check just to spell "Hawaiian."  

I had the garlic chicken.  A healthy portion of fried boneless chicken thighs topped with a mayonnaise based sauce. (I had to spell check mayonnaise too --- 2 "n's")  It was crispy, juicy, and tasty!  The dash of sesame seeds was a nice touch.  I tasted a hint of sesame oil, too.   Then of course 2 scoops of rice and mac salad.  It was all good!

I like this place.  It is family owned.  Prices are about average.

The Ninth Island.
It's a nickname for Las Vegas because over 90,000 former residents of Hawaii now call Sin City home.  And because of that, we are lucky to have several options for onolicious eats in the Vegas Valley and 808 Hawaii Mixed Plate is one of my favorites.  First of all, it's near our house, which is always a plus.
Secondly, the food is delicious.  Thirdly, the staff always displays the aloha spirit with their customers.  
I've had the furikake chicken, garlic chicken, Spam musubi, and Kalbi short ribs, all tasty every time.  The portions are generous and I usually need to take some food home because I can't finish everything in one sitting.  
If you are a fan of food from Hawaii, 808 HMP's menu offers you lots of options: saimin, Kalua Pork and Cabbage, mahi mahi, Loco Moco, breakfast served all day, and more.  Get some ono grindz here the next time you want a taste of the islands.
I come here every once in a while when I need really Amazing Hawaiian food that never lets me down

This place has raving reviews so I had to come try it when I went back to Vegas. My boyfriend and I came here on a Monday night for take out, and even though it's a Mon night, there were still a few group of people there. 

We ordered the hurricane fries (because i freaking love hurricane popcorns), fried spam musubi, garlic chicken/beef plate, and loco moco/katsu plate. I originally ordered the short ribs, but they ran out that night! Which is fine because everything else was sooo yummy. 

The wait was about 15 minutes or so. They actually also sell hawaiian mochi bread on the side, they let me sample a bite and i actually really liked it LOL. So if you want something sweet on the side i recommend that you get a piece. 

now the food. the food was absolutely AMAZING. The portion is BIG (2 full scoop of rice and lotsss of meat!) and definitely will fill you up, and the food was full of flavor. I was throughout impressed with how yummy it was actually. I love going to L&L, aloha kitchen and all that stuff but i think this place was on another level. I also love their macaroni/potato salad. 

I am not from Hawai'i but, I would like to say that I know a little bit about all the asian food out there and this place is definitely one of the best! Loved it.

My wife and I are from Hawaii and we have been looking for a good Hawaiian food place for a long time- not the generic, (owned by people that are not from Hawaii) "L&L, or Ono's" - they don't understand what local food is supposed to look and taste like! We have been looking for local food that is currently being served in Hawaii, but here on the mainland- well, we hit the jackpot!!! This place is so good, we would probably eat here 3 times a week if we lived in Vegas!!! The chef is a gourmet chef from Hawaii and "gets it" - he's on top of what's happening now and makes it with a gourmet touch- We would eat here if it were IN Hawaii!!! - seriously fresh and tasty - not generic or over greasy, and they live up to their name "mix plate" - which is hard to find in some so called "Hawaiian food" places! You can mix just about any thing on the menu! - now that's real Hawaiian style!! - also, they make their own desserts!!! if they have it, you must get the "Haupia square" - its probably the best dessert we have ever had! And we are foodies!!! - If you crave good Hawaiian local food, you must try this place!!! - Aloha!!
Great Hawaiian food in Las Vegas, who would have thought such amazing food could be found in the Mohave desert.

Ordered the mixed plate. Kalbi beef ribs and firecracker chicken. Ribs were 80% fat and firecracker chicken tastes just like orange chicken from panda express... wouldn't recommend based on my experience
LOVE the kaluha pig wit cabbage. My fav!!  I also got the garlic chicken and that miso mayo sauce is so delish!!  Their macaroni salad is one of my favorites compared to other restaurants.

Aloha North Vegas Yelpers!

This is the closest place to me that offers local food.
I had a late lunch here last week with my guy. We both come from Hawaii and love local food.

I had the kaukau pack which is their version of a bento. I choose garlic ahi and sesame chicken. It comes with white rice and fried noodles. Great taste and reasonable price costing $8

My guy loves the korean chicken plate and Portuguese sausage here.
To me their version of Korean chicken is OKAY... I would suggest something else... like their garlic ahi!

Why -1 star?
super long wait... really long wait... did I mention there's a wait? 
and the menu is limited but I'm ok with quality, not quantity. 
I guess I wish there was more HAWAIIAN food on the menu, I say this is more of local food from Hawaii. I guess I had my share of other Hawaiian spots in the city, so I've been to places that has more variety.

This place reminds me of a place you would find in Hawaii. Very friendly staff! I love Hawaii people! One lady there reminds me of my grandma back home. Gotta love the aloha spirit!

Will I come back?
YES!
I'll probably call in my order a head of time to cut out the wait, now that I have their menu.

+ military drinks free! Indoor seating. Super Casual. Lots of free parking.

Mahalo 808 MP!

-Miss Yelp 2011
Constantly make the trip across Vegas for great Hawaiian food!

Garlic chicken=omg delicious!

If you're tired of the typical chicken katsu, I suggest you try the garlic chicken! It's mouthwateringly amazing.

Service is always great and the workers are quite friendly and nice. I have never had a bad experience here regardless of whether or not I ate in or got togo.

The Boyfriend and I were looking for a quick and fun lunch date in North Vegas and I came across 808 on Yelp. I was very disappointed in this place for so many reasons, the first being the short but rediculously SLOW line at the register. Upon reaching the register, the midget-girl working the register had a rude attitude and was wearing oversized mens shoes, as she told me the short ribs I wanted to order would take 20-30 minutes because as she put it "there are a lot of food orders ahead of you", which translated into a big fat F U. Uhm, OK.....if I wanted to wait half an hour to eat I would've stayed home and cooked! Lame. So I ordered the Kahlua pork and my BF ordered the garlic chicken. 

Someone's nice grandma in house slippers delivered my lunch to the table. Just my plate. Call me crazy, but when two people sit down to eat, it's nice to have your meals brought out together, not 15 minutes apart. It really detracted from the whole date part of our lunch. Having all that time to sit there and look around the place, it was pretty disorganized and dirty. I felt bad for dragging the BF to this crap hole for lunch when we dont get that much time together as it is. I didn't care for the pork, so I didn't eat it, the Mac salad was good, and BF liked his chicken. 

Yeah, won't be going back. Yuck.

You want ono grinds, come get some @ 808 Mixed Plate!
Store Front - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/808-hawaii-mixed-plate-north-las-vegas?select=ci2E-6mPrUh3k0WQOpkUmA#ci2E-6mPrUh3k0WQOpkUmA

Disclaimer: All my cousin SE & I ordered was da' Mixed Plate Combo, winnahs!
(BTW - We had just picked up about $40 worth of poke from Poke Express, just a few doors down.)
Poke Express (N Las Vegas) - http://www.yelp.com/biz/poke-express-north-las-vegas

In between the ono'licious garlic chicken, kalbi short ribs, mac salad & hot rice... 'AND poke!!
We ate like Kamehameha! Buggah was good.
Photo - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/808-hawaii-mixed-plate-north-las-vegas?select=ci2E-6mPrUh3k0WQOpkUmA#3OxIl0-t0Q0pyTyjjg4Jbg
(I stay drooling ova' my keyboard reminiscing about that lunch... *sigh)

Like most local Hawaiian kine places, very low-key, no frills, simple... 'With ono kaukau. ("good food")
Photo - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/808-hawaii-mixed-plate-north-las-vegas?select=ci2E-6mPrUh3k0WQOpkUmA#hOqvox8j6KcMXhY5DSjbPQ 
Wasn't too crowded. I was surprised that they did not offer KERNS PoG - Passion Orange Guava, a local staple. (shrugs) Whateva', no worries! 

Great plaza - Plate lunch & poke?!... 'No can lose bruddah!!

- Big Aloha!

Food: 5
Ambiance: 3
Service: 3
Value: 5
Friendly service great food, must try the spam musubi. Another note is they're closed Mondays

I recently changed jobs and now I'm in this area, so of course I Yelp near by places. That's when I see 808 and the reviews. I've been craving a decent Loco Moco for awhile now. Well I found it! The gravy had a great taste,  the patties were real with onion in them (could use some more seasonings) and well in size, rice cooked all the way, egg was a perfect over easy. Portion size was big, couldn't eat all of it. I also got the macaroni salad as a side, it was a bit dry to me I like it a little more saucy but it tasted good. I will be back for more and other things.
Super boooomb... Garlic chicken on point also the bbq beef is real good awesome flavor. Glad i live so close. I say order online that way you really dont have to wait you can be in and out.

I've had this place on my radar for quite some time but I could never get off my okole to drive up to North Vegas to try this place out. Luckily one day we were up in the neighborhood doing errands and this made a perfect opportunity..

I ordered a combo Kalbi & Garlic Chicken plate and the GF ordered the 808 mixed plate. 

I was a little taken by surprise when they asked me how I wanted my Kalbi cooked. Bewildered I said medium-rare? 
When my plate came out I understood why...
Kalbi steak action! The Kalbi was sliced thick and filleted like a steak!  A welcome change from the usual 1/4" ones your get everywhere else. My kalbi steak was ono! 

Their garlic chicken is different than what we all expect when we order it. It comes with this white garlic/mayo crack sauce on it. Onolisish anyways..

The 808 mixed plate is a good value. Nothing too crazy here: SPAM, teri beef and a choice of chicken. She got the sesame chicken which was onolish. 
I know it sounds stupid but the star of the plate is the fried noodles. It reminds me manapua mans noodles back home. 

I dig the food here but for me it's just too far for me to frequent all of the time but at least I know where to get local grindz when I'm up in North Vegas.

I was really looking at trying something here since I had just picked up some Poke a few doors down.
Walked in and as I approached the counter the lady behind said they are closed. Had almost a full house still but I left since I understand people want to get home after a long day at work.
I glanced at the Sunday times that they are open on the front door and it said until 4:30 today.
Glanced at my iPhone and it read 4:27pm.
Just asking, should restaurants take food orders if they are still open?
I hope the food is good since I didn't feel the Hawaiian spirit.
I've never had anything so disgusting in my life.  The chicken was all fat... If that was chicken.  The beef was a weird and discolored.

Two words: Garlic chicken. Try it, won't be disappointed. Even got it catered for a birthday party. 

The service is awesome too. Make you feel welcomed

Sesame chicken plate you can go no wrong. Sticky rice on point, pan fried sesame chicken and probably the best mac salad in the ninth island...Just too bad that this place is at the outer reaches of sin city civilization...

Good local grindz, and close to the house too. Staff is super friendly, and very attentive to drinks and (with kids) messes.  _Prices are reasonable.  Can't beat that.

Wife had garlic chicken, she loved it. Kids always get spam musubi (when they order it, they pronounce it 'MOO-su-bi') and Saimin.  This was the first time I tried the Zippy's special, chili rice with hot dog. This chili is dang good, highly recommended. Rumor has it malasadas are coming, so we're patiently waiting. A shave ice machine wouldn't hurt too ;)
